Steam (ST): Genji tightened his bow tie and looked outside through a crack in the curtains.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji once again tightened his bow tie, and looked outside through a crack in the curtains.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji once again tightened his bow tie, and looked outside through a crack in the curtains.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は蝶ネクタイを固く締め直すと、カーテンの隙間から外を見た。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次は蝶ネクタイを固く締め直すと、カーテンの隙間から外を見た。

Vietnamese (VI): Genji once again tightened his bow tie, and looked outside through a crack in the curtains.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次系紧蝶形领结，从窗帘的缝隙间向外望去。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Genji si strinse nuovamente il papillon, e tramite uno spiraglio delle tende, guardò fuori la finestra.
Turkish (TR): Genji papyonunu bir kez daha sıktı ve perdelerdeki aralıktan dışarıya baktı.

Steam (ST): Maybe the rain had died down a tiny bit since the previous night. ...But the thick rainclouds didn't seem like they'd be letting any trace of the morning sun get by.
Umineko Project (UP): Maybe the rain had died down a tiny bit since the previous night.{n}...But it didn't look like the thick rain‐clouds were planning to let any trace of the morning sun get by.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe the rain had died down a tiny bit since the previous night....But it didn't look like the thick rain-clouds were planning to let any trace of the morning sun get by.
PC Japanese (JP): 昨夜に比べればほんの少しは雨脚も弱まっただろうか。…でも、分厚い雨雲はわずかほどの朝の太陽も、その気配さえも許すつもりはないらしい。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 昨夜に比べればほんの少しは雨脚も弱まっただろうか。{n}…でも、分厚い雨雲はわずかほどの朝の太陽も、その気配さえも許すつもりはないらしい。
Russian (RU): Дождь, может, немного и поутих с прошлой ночи.{n}...Но было непохоже, чтобы густые дождевые облака намеревались пропустить хотя бы несколько лучиков утреннего солнца.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez a chuva tivesse acalmado um pouco desde a noite anterior.{n}...Mas não parecia que as nuvens negras planejavam deixar passar qualquer traço do sol matinal.
Vietnamese (VI): Maybe the rain had died down a tiny bit since the previous night.{n}...But it didn't look like the thick rain‐clouds were planning to let any trace of the morning sun get by.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雨勢似乎比昨晚稍微弱了一點。{n}…但是，厚重的烏雲好像一點都不打算讓清晨的太陽露一下臉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 雨势似乎比昨晚稍微弱了一点。{n}…但是，厚重的乌云好像一点都不打算让清晨的太阳露一下脸。
Indonesian (IDN): Maybe the rain had died down a tiny bit since the previous night. ...But the thick rainclouds didn't seem like they'd be letting any trace of the morning sun get by.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse la pioggia era leggermente cessata dalla notte precedente. ... Ma non sembrava che le nuvole scure e cariche di pioggia avessero intenzione di far uscire il sole mattutino.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La pioggia sembrava leggermente meno scrosciante, se paragonata a quella di ieri sera... Ma i nuvoloni sembravano determinati a non far traspirare neanche un raggio di sole mattutino.
Turkish (TR): Belki de yağmur önceki geceden beri biraz dinmişti.{n}...Ama koyu yağmur bulutları sabah güneşinden geçişine izin verecek gibi görünmüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The morning was dim, and far from refreshing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The morning was dim, and far from refreshing.

Vietnamese (VI): The morning was dim, and far from refreshing.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): ".........It seems it will last all day after all."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........As expected, it doesn't seem that it will stop today..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........As expected, it doesn't seem that it will stop today."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………やはり、今日いっぱいは止みそうにないか…」

Vietnamese (VI): ".........As expected, it doesn't seem that it will stop today..."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………果然今天一整天，这雨是不会停了啊…」

Speaker: Kanon
Steam (ST): "Sorry for keeping you waiting, Genji-sama."
Umineko Project (UP): "My apologies for keeping you waiting, Genji‐sama."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Sorry for keeping you waiting, Genji-sama."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お待たせしました、源次さま」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Desculpe‐me por fazê‐lo esperar, Genji‐sama."
Vietnamese (VI): "My apologies for keeping you waiting, Genji‐sama."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「让您久等了，源次先生。」

Turkish (TR): "Sizi beklettiğim için özür dilerim, Genji-sama."

Steam (ST): Kanon finished checking his appearance and exited the washroom. On their normal schedule, it was rare for anyone to have to suffer going straight from a midnight shift to an early morning shift.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon finished checking his appearance, and exited the washroom.{n}In a normal schedule, it was rare for anyone to have to suffer going straight from a midnight shift to a morning shift.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon finished checking his appearance, and exited the washroom. In a normal schedule, it was rare for anyone to have to suffer going straight from a midnight shift to a morning shift.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音が身なりの確認を終え、洗面所から出てくる。普段のシフトなら、深夜勤から早朝勤につながるような辛いことはそうない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音が身なりの確認を終え、洗面所から出てくる。{n}普段のシフトなら、深夜勤から早朝勤につながるような辛いことはそうない。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音把衣服穿戴整齐后，从盥洗室走了出来。{n}要是按平常的排班，这种深夜班紧接早班的累人安排并不多。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kanon terminò di prepararsi, e uscì dal bagno. In orari normali, era raro per chiunque dover eseguire il turno di mezzanotte e subito dopo quello mattutino.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kanon terminò di prepararsi, e uscì dalla toilette. In circostanze normali, non era così faticoso passare al turno mattutino dopo aver svolto il turno di notte.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): While doing that, he passed in front of the kitchen.
PC Japanese (JP): その途中で厨房の前を通りかかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その途中で厨房の前を通りかかった。
Russian (RU): Занятый этим делом, он прошёл мимо кухни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto prosseguia, passou em frente à cozinha.
Vietnamese (VI): While doing that, he passed in front of the kitchen.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在開窗簾的途中他走到了廚房前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在开窗帘的途中他走到了厨房前。
Indonesian (IDN): While doing that, he passed in front of the kitchen.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Continuando a fare in questo modo, passò di fronte alla cucina.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Durante il suo tragitto, passò di fronte alla cucina...
Turkish (TR): Bunları yaparken mutfağın önünden geçti.

Steam (ST): ...Even though he hadn't smelled anything yet, his stomach started aching for some of Gohda's prized cooking.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Even though he hadn't yet smelled anything, his empty stomach started aching in anticipation of the scent of Gohda's much bragged‐about cooking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Even though he knew that he wouldn't be able to smell it yet, his stomach started aching for some of Gohda's much bragged about cooking.
PC Japanese (JP): …まだ嗅げてもいないはずなのに、郷田自慢の料理の匂いを先に期待して、空腹の胃袋が疼くのを感じる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …まだ嗅げてもいないはずなのに、郷田自慢の料理の匂いを先に期待して、空腹の胃袋が疼くのを感じる。
Russian (RU): ...И хотя он ещё ничего не учуял, его живот заурчал от предвкушения еды, которой так хвастался Года.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mesmo não tendo sentido o cheiro de nada ainda, seu estômago vazio começou a roncar em antecipação ao cheiro da comida, da qual Gohda tanto se gabava.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Even though he hadn't yet smelled anything, his empty stomach started aching in anticipation of the scent of Gohda's much bragged‐about cooking.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …明明還沒有聞到任何味道，但是因為早就在期待鄉田引以為豪的料理所發出的香味，他還是感到了空腹的疼痛感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …明明还没有闻到任何味道，但是因为早就在期待乡田引以为豪的料理所发出的香味，他还是感到了空腹的疼痛感。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Even though he hadn't smelled anything yet, his stomach started aching for some of Gohda's prized cooking.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Anche se sapeva che non avrebbe potuto assaggiarla ancora, il suo stomaco cominciò a brontolare al pensiero della cucina di cui Gohda si vantava tanto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Anche se non aveva ancora sentito alcun odore, i morsi della fame lo attanagliavano, all'idea di pregustarsi gli aromi della cucina di cui Gouda era fiero.
Turkish (TR): ...Henüz hiçbir şeyin kokusunu almamış olsa da, Gohda'nın o çok övündüğü yemeklerinin kokusunu beklerken boş midesi guruldamaya başladı.

Speaker: Kanon
PC Japanese (JP): 「………おはようございます。………………？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………おはようございます。………………？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Buongiorno. ...?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Buongiorno...?"

Steam (ST): He tried to greet Gohda, who should have been getting breakfast ready, but Gohda was nowhere to be seen.
Umineko Project (UP): He tried to greet Gohda, who he had thought would be preparing the meal inside the kitchen, but Gohda was nowhere to be seen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He tried to greet Gohda, who he had thought would be preparing the meal inside the kitchen, but Gohda was nowhere to be seen.
PC Japanese (JP): 中で準備に勤しんでいるであろう郷田に挨拶しようとしたが、厨房に郷田の姿はなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 中で準備に勤しんでいるであろう郷田に挨拶しようとしたが、厨房に郷田の姿はなかった。
Russian (RU): Он намеревался поприветствовать Году, который, как он думал, занят приготовлением завтрака. Но Годы нигде не было видно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele tentou cumprimentar Gohda, que pensava estar na cozinha preparando o café da manhã, mas Gohda não estava em lugar algum.
Vietnamese (VI): He tried to greet Gohda, who he had thought would be preparing the meal inside the kitchen, but Gohda was nowhere to be seen.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他本想跟理應在裡面辛勤準備早餐的鄉田打聲招呼，但是廚房裡並沒有鄉田的身影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他本想跟理应在里面辛勤准备早餐的乡田打声招呼，但是厨房里并没有乡田的身影。
Indonesian (IDN): He tried to greet Gohda, who should have been getting breakfast ready, but Gohda was nowhere to be seen.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tentò di salutare Gohda, che pensò stesse preparando le pietanze in cucina, ma di Gohda non c'era traccia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kanon stava per salutare Gouda, che avrebbe dovuto essere nel bel mezzo dei preparativi, ma in cucina non vi era alcuna sua traccia.
Turkish (TR): Yemeği mutfakta hazırlayacağını düşündüğü Gohda'ya selam vermek istedi ama Gohda ortalıkta görünmüyordu.

Steam (ST): The kitchen was darkly lit, and not only were the curtains not open, but the fan wasn't even running.
Umineko Project (UP): The kitchen was darkly lit, and never mind the curtains, the ventilation fan wasn't even spinning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The kitchen was darkly lit, and there was no fan for ventilation, much less curtains to be opened.
PC Japanese (JP): 厨房は薄暗く、カーテンどころか換気扇すら回っていない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 厨房は薄暗く、カーテンどころか換気扇すら回っていない。
Russian (RU): Кухня была тускло освещена, и не говоря уже о том, что шторы так и не были раздёрнуты, вытяжной вентилятор находился в полном покое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A cozinha estava escura e, além das cortinas fechadas, o ventilador de teto estava desligado.
Vietnamese (VI): The kitchen was darkly lit, and never mind the curtains, the ventilation fan wasn't even spinning.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 昏暗的廚房裡，不僅沒有拉開窗簾，就連換氣扇都沒轉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 昏暗的厨房里，不仅没有拉开窗帘，就连换气扇都没转。
Indonesian (IDN): The kitchen was darkly lit, and not only were the curtains not open, but the fan wasn't even running.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La cucina era illuminata in maniera soffusa, e non vi era alcun ventilatore, ne tantomeno finestre.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Le luci erano spente, e non solo le tende erano chiuse, ma la cappa non era neanche attiva.
Turkish (TR): Mutfak karanlıktı ve perdeleri bırakın, havalandırma fanı bile dönmüyordu.

Steam (ST): It was still cold, without any trace of a fire being lit, so of course there were no signs of breakfast being made either.
Umineko Project (UP): It was still cold in the room, without a hint of a flame, and of course no preparations for breakfast were taking place.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since it was still cold without a hint of a fire, it was obvious that no preparations for breakfast were taking place.
PC Japanese (JP): 火の気もなく寒々しいままで、無論、朝食の準備が行なわれている様子もなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 火の気もなく寒々しいままで、無論、朝食の準備が行なわれている様子もなかった。
Russian (RU): Поскольку на кухне царила прохлада безо всякого намёка на разведённый огонь, было очевидно, что завтрак ещё не начал готовиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda estava frio dentro do cômodo, sem nenhum sinal de uma chama, e obviamente nenhum café da manhã estava sendo preparado.
Vietnamese (VI): It was still cold in the room, without a hint of a flame, and of course no preparations for breakfast were taking place.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 沒一點熱氣，房間內依然寒冷，當然，也根本沒有在準備早餐的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 没一点热气，房间内依然寒冷，当然，也根本没有在准备早餐的样子。
Indonesian (IDN): It was still cold, without any trace of a fire being lit, so of course there were no signs of breakfast being made either.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dal momento che c'era ancora molto freddo senza tracce di fuochi accesi, era ovvio che nessuno stesse preparando la colazione.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): L'aria era glaciale, senza il benché minimo calore di una fiamma, ed era palese che non era stata preparata alcuna colazione...
Turkish (TR): Odanın içi hâlâ soğuktu, ateşten eser yoktu ve tabii ki kahvaltı için hiçbir hazırlık yapılmıyordu.

Steam (ST): ...Though it would have been inexcusable, perhaps Gohda had overslept.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Although it must not be allowed to happen, maybe Gohda had overslept.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Even though it wouldn't be permitted, maybe Gohda had overslept.
PC Japanese (JP): …あってはならないことだが、郷田が寝坊しているのかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …あってはならないことだが、郷田が寝坊しているのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ...И хотя такое было недопустимым, но, может, Года проспал?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Apesar de ser algo que não se deveria deixar acontecer, talvez Gohda tivesse dormido demais.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Although it must not be allowed to happen, maybe Gohda had overslept.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …雖然這基本是不可能的，但說不定鄉田真睡過頭了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽然这基本是不可能的，但说不定乡田真睡过头了。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Though it would have been inexcusable, perhaps Gohda had overslept.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sebbene non fosse permesso, forse Gohda aveva dormito un po' troppo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era inaccettabile, ma forse Gouda stava ancora dormendo.
Turkish (TR): ...Bunun olmasına izin verilmemesi gerekse de, belki de Gohda uyuyakalmıştı.

Steam (ST): Even servants are only human. They sometimes sleep in and show up late.
Umineko Project (UP): Servants are humans too.{n}They can sometimes fail to wake up or something, and be late as a result.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even servants are human. They can sometimes be late when they are unable to wake up.
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人も人間だ。時には起きられなかったりして遅刻することもある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 使用人も人間だ。{n}時には起きられなかったりして遅刻することもある。
Russian (RU): Слуги ведь тоже люди.{n}Порой они тоже могут опоздать, когда им не удаётся проснуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Serviçais também são humanos.{n}Eles podem não acordar na hora ou coisa parecida às vezes e, portanto, se atrasar.
Vietnamese (VI): Servants are humans too.{n}They can sometimes fail to wake up or something, and be late as a result.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傭人也是人。{n}有時也會因起不了床而遲到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 佣人也是人。{n}有时也会因起不了床而迟到。
Indonesian (IDN): Even servants are only human. They sometimes sleep in and show up late.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche i domestici sono umani. A volte possono arrivare in ritardo se non riescono ad alzarsi dal letto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Anche i domestici erano esseri umani. A volte non riuscivano ad alzarsi, e facevano ritardo...
Turkish (TR): Hizmetkârlar da birer insan.{n}Bazen uyanamayabilirler ve sonuç olarak geç kalabilirler.

Steam (ST): ...In the rare case that such a thing happens, it's part of a servant's code to hide the unsightly scene before anyone notices, smoothly cover it up, and make sure the family never even realizes that anything has gone wrong.
Umineko Project (UP): ...In the rare case of that happening, it was the virtue of a servant to casually smooth the situation over so as not to cause an unsightly scene, and to make sure that their masters never even notice that such a mistake happened in the first place.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...In the rare case when that happened, clamoring to hide the unsightly scene, casually smoothing it over, and making sure that the presence of such a mistake was never noticed by the master were just some of a servant's virtues.
PC Japanese (JP): …そのようなことが万一あった時、騒ぎにして無様を晒さないよう、さり気無くフォローし、そのようなミスがあったことすら主人たちに悟らせないのもまた、使用人の美徳であった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …そのようなことが万一あった時、騒ぎにして無様を晒さないよう、さり気無くフォローし、そのようなミスがあったことすら主人たちに悟らせないのもまた、使用人の美徳であった。
Russian (RU): ...В таких редких случаях поступать так, чтобы скрыть такой прокол, постараться гибко сгладить его и позаботиться о том, чтобы хозяева не стали свидетелями такой оплошности, является одним из достоинств слуг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Nas raras ocasiões em que isso acontecia, era virtude dos serviçais fazer algo a respeito para se evitar constrangimentos e também evitar que os patrões sequer percebessem que tal erro havia ocorrido.
Vietnamese (VI): ...In the rare case of that happening, it was the virtue of a servant to casually smooth the situation over so as not to cause an unsightly scene, and to make sure that their masters never even notice that such a mistake happened in the first place.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …在事出萬一，真發生了這種事情的時候，不去吵起來把事情鬧大，而是若無其事地盡量補救，不讓這種小錯誤被主人們察覺，也是傭人的美德。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …在事出万一，真发生了这种事情的时候，不去吵起来把事情闹大，而是若无其事地尽量补救，不让这种小错误被主人们察觉，也是佣人的美德。
Indonesian (IDN): ...In the rare case that such a thing happens, it's part of a servant's code to hide the unsightly scene before anyone notices, smoothly cover it up, and make sure the family never even realizes that anything has gone wrong.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nei rari casi in cui questo accadeva, fare chiasso per camuffare l'orrenda scena, sistemare le cose con nonchalance, e assicurarsi che la presenza di un tale errore non venisse mai scoperta dal padrone, erano solo alcuni dei meriti di un domestico.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Nei rarissimi casi in cui accadeva qualcosa del genere, un bravo domestico doveva celare la situazione incresciosa, sistemare tutto con nonchalance, ed infine, assicurarsi che i suoi superiori non notino neppure che sia successo qualcosa.
Turkish (TR): ...Nadiren de olsa böyle bir durumla karşılaşıldığında, bir hizmetkârın görevi, çirkin bir sahneye neden olmamak için, durumu çaktırmadan düzeltmek ve efendilerinin böyle bir hatanın yapıldığının farkına bile varmamasını sağlamaktır.

Steam (ST): Kanon took the receiver of the phone that had been fitted to the wall and dialed the number for the extension line in the servant sleeping room.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon took up the receiver of the phone fitted to the wall, and dialed the extension number for the room where the servants slept.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon took the receiver of the phone that had been fitted to the wall and dialed the number for the extension line to the room where the servants slept.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は壁に備え付けられている電話の受話器を取ると、使用人宿泊室の内線番号をダイヤルする。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音は壁に備え付けられている電話の受話器を取ると、使用人宿泊室の内線番号をダイヤルする。
Russian (RU): Сняв трубку с прикреплённого к стене телефона, Канон набрал номер для линии, ведущей в комнату, в которой спали слуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon tirou o telefone de parede do gancho e discou o número do ramal do quarto onde os serviçais dormiam.
Vietnamese (VI): Kanon took up the receiver of the phone fitted to the wall, and dialed the extension number for the room where the servants slept.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音拿起鑲在牆上的電話話筒，撥了傭人臥房的內線號碼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音拿起镶在墙上的电话话筒，拨了佣人卧房的内线号码。
Indonesian (IDN): Kanon took the receiver of the phone that had been fitted to the wall and dialed the number for the extension line in the servant sleeping room.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kanon prese la cornetta del telefono che era stato fissato al muro e compose il numero della stanza dove dormivano i domestici.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kanon prese la cornetta del telefono fissato al muro, e compose il numero interno della stanza in cui alloggiavano i domestici.
Turkish (TR): Kanon duvara monte edilmiş telefonun ahizesini kaldırdı ve hizmetkârların uyuduğu odanın dahili numarasını çevirdi.

Steam (ST): ......He couldn't hear that characteristic sound of a dial tone.
Umineko Project (UP): ......He couldn't hear that characteristic sound of a dial tone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......He couldn't hear that characteristic sound of a dial tone.
PC Japanese (JP): ……独特のツーという機械音を感じない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……独特のツーという機械音を感じない。
Russian (RU): ......Телефонная трубка не отзывалась характерным для неё гудком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele não pôde ouvir o som característico da discagem.
Vietnamese (VI): ......He couldn't hear that characteristic sound of a dial tone.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……聽筒中並沒有傳來獨特的“嘟”聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……听筒中并没有传来独特的“嘟”声。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Il suono dell'apertura della chiamata non era partito.
Turkish (TR): ......Çevirme sesinin o karakteristik sesini duyamadı.

Steam (ST): Kanon tried picking up the receiver again, but even so, he couldn't hear the usual dial tone.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon tried picking up the receiver again, but even so, he couldn't hear the usual dial tone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon tried picking up the receiver again, but even so, he couldn't hear the usual dial tone.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音は受話器を取り直してみるが、それでもいつもの機械音を聞くことはできなかった。

Vietnamese (VI): Kanon tried picking up the receiver again, but even so, he couldn't hear the usual dial tone.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音把話筒放回去又拿了起來，但即便如此還是聽不到平常都有的那聲機械音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音把话筒放回去又拿了起来，但即便如此还是听不到平常都有的那声机械音。

Steam (ST): He tried dialing again, but it had no apparent effect.
Umineko Project (UP): He tried dialing again, but it had no apparent effect.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He tried dialing again, but it had no apparent effect.

Russian (RU): Он повторил это несколько раз, но тщетно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele tentou discar mais uma vez, sem efeito aparente.
Vietnamese (VI): He tried dialing again, but it had no apparent effect.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他又重新撥了遍號碼，但依舊沒有任何反應。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他又重新拨了遍号码，但依旧没有任何反应。
Indonesian (IDN): He tried dialing again, but it had no apparent effect.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Provò a ricomporre il numero, ma non fece alcun effetto...

Steam (ST): ......Could the lightning last night have damaged some machine, breaking the extension line?
Umineko Project (UP): ......Could it be that the lightning last night had caused a mechanical fault and broken the internal telephone lines?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Could it be that the lightning last night had done something to one of the machines and broken the extension phone?
PC Japanese (JP): ……ひょっとすると、昨夜の落雷で何か機械に異常でも出て、内線電話が壊れてしまったのだろうか？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……ひょっとすると、昨夜の落雷で何か機械に異常でも出て、内線電話が壊れてしまったのだろうか？
Russian (RU): ......Может быть, молния прошлой ночью что‐то повредила и вывела из строя местный телефон?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Poderiam os raios da noite passada terem causado algum dano e quebrado a linha interna?
Vietnamese (VI): ......Could it be that the lightning last night had caused a mechanical fault and broken the internal telephone lines?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……難道是昨晚的雷擊讓機械出了什麼故障，把內線電話弄壞了嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……难道是昨晚的雷击让机械出了什么故障，把内线电话弄坏了吗？
Indonesian (IDN): ......Could the lightning last night have damaged some machine, breaking the extension line?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Forse il temporale della notte scorsa aveva fatto qualcosa alla centralina e rotto le linee interne?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Che la causa dello scollegamento della linea interna fosse dovuta al temporale della sera precedente?
Turkish (TR): ......Dün gece çakan şimşek mekanik bir arızaya neden olmuş ve dahili telefon hatlarını bozmuş olabilir miydi?

Steam (ST): The equipment in this mansion was all worn out. Kanon fully understood that even the smallest thing could have caused it to break down.
Umineko Project (UP): The equipment in this mansion was all worn out.{n}Kanon fully understood that even the smallest thing could have caused it to break down.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The equipment in this mansion was all worn out. Kanon fully understood that even the smallest thing could have caused it to break down.
PC Japanese (JP): この屋敷の設備は老朽化している。ささやかなことで故障することがあるのを嘉音は充分に承知していた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この屋敷の設備は老朽化している。{n}ささやかなことで故障することがあるのを嘉音は充分に承知していた。
Russian (RU): Оборудование в особняке было порядком изношенным.{n}Канон прекрасно понимал, что даже мелочь способна вызвать его неисправность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O equipamento da mansão tinha muito tempo de uso.{n}Kanon entendia perfeitamente que a menor coisa poderia fazê‐lo quebrar.
Vietnamese (VI): The equipment in this mansion was all worn out.{n}Kanon fully understood that even the smallest thing could have caused it to break down.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這幢大屋裡的設備已經老化。{n}嘉音十分清楚一點小事就會讓它出故障。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这幢大屋里的设备已经老化。{n}嘉音十分清楚一点小事就会让它出故障。
Indonesian (IDN): The equipment in this mansion was all worn out. Kanon fully understood that even the smallest thing could have caused it to break down.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): L'attrezzatura nella villa era tutta usurata. Kanon sapeva bene che anche la più piccola cosa avrebbe potuto causare un guasto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il complesso della villa era fatiscente. Kanon era consapevole che anche la più piccola inezia poteva causare un guasto.
Turkish (TR): Bu malikânedeki ekipmanların hepsi yıpranmıştı.{n}Kanon, en küçük bir şeyin bile bozulmasına neden olabileceğini tamamen anlamıştı.

Steam (ST): He gave up trying to wake Gohda with the phone and dashed over to the servant sleeping room.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon gave up trying to wake him with the phone, and dashed off to the room where the servants slept.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon gave up trying to wake him with the phone, and dashed over to the room where the servants slept.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は電話で起こすことを諦め、使用人宿泊室へ駆けていった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音は電話で起こすことを諦め、使用人宿泊室へ駆けていった。
Russian (RU): Оставив попытки добудиться до Годы при помощи телефона, Канон побежал в комнату, где спали слуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon desistiu de tentar acordá‐lo pelo telefone e correu até as acomodações dos serviçais.
Vietnamese (VI): Kanon gave up trying to wake him with the phone, and dashed off to the room where the servants slept.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他放棄了用電話叫醒鄉田，跑向了傭人臥房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他放弃了用电话叫醒乡田，跑向了佣人卧房。
Indonesian (IDN): He gave up trying to wake Gohda with the phone and dashed over to the servant sleeping room.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kanon smise di tentare di svegliarlo col telefono, e si precipitò nella stanza in cui dormivano i domestici.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kanon rinunciò a tentare di svegliarlo dal telefono, e corse verso la stanza in cui alloggiavano i domestici.
Turkish (TR): Kanon onu telefonla uyandırmaya çalışmaktan vazgeçti ve hizmetkârların uyuduğu odaya koştu.

Steam (ST): ...How long has it been since I stopped sleeping and started lazily staring up at the ceiling?
Umineko Project (UP): ...How long had she slept until? How long had it been since she had awoken and started lazily staring up at the ceiling?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...How long had she slept until? How long had it been since she had awoken and started lazily staring up at the ceiling?
PC Japanese (JP): いつまで眠っていたのか、いつから目を覚ましぼんやりと天井を見上げていたのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いつまで眠っていたのか、いつから目を覚ましぼんやりと天井を見上げていたのか。
Russian (RU): ...Как долго она спала? И сколько времени прошло с тех пор, как она проснулась, вяло уставившись в потолок?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por quanto tempo ela tinha dormido? Quanto tempo teria passado desde que acordou e começou a olhar de forma distraída o teto do quarto?
Vietnamese (VI): ...How long had she slept until? How long had it been since she had awoken and started lazily staring up at the ceiling?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自己到底是睡了多久，又到底是什麼時候醒過來，開始迷迷糊糊地盯著天花板發呆的呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自己到底是睡了多久，又到底是什么时候醒过来，开始迷迷糊糊地盯着天花板发呆的呢？
Indonesian (IDN): ...How long has it been since I stopped sleeping and started lazily staring up at the ceiling?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Per quanto tempo aveva dormito? Quanto tempo era passato da quando si era svegliata e aveva cominciato a fissare il soffitto?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): ...Per quanto tempo aveva dormito? Da quanto tempo stava fissando vagamente il soffitto...?
Turkish (TR): ...Ne zamana kadar uyumuştu? Uyanıp da tembel tembel tavana bakmaya başlayalı ne kadar olmuştu?

Steam (ST): ......That vague sense of awakening was part of Natsuhi's usual morning experience.
Umineko Project (UP): ......That vague sense of awakening was Natsuhi's usual morning experience.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That vague sense of awakening was Natsuhi's usual morning experience.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そんな曖昧な目覚めが、いつもの夏妃の朝であった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……そんな曖昧な目覚めが、いつもの夏妃の朝であった。
Russian (RU): ......Это чувство неопределённости, испытываемое Нацухи при пробуждении, было для неё по утрам обычным делом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Essa sensação vaga de despertar era a experiência normal da Natsuhi ao acordar.
Vietnamese (VI): ......That vague sense of awakening was Natsuhi's usual morning experience.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……夏妃的每一個早晨，都是在這樣模糊的清醒中來臨的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……夏妃的每一个早晨，都是在这样模糊的清醒中来临的。
Indonesian (IDN): ......That vague sense of awakening was part of Natsuhi's usual morning experience.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quella vaga sensazione di dormiveglia era il risveglio tipico di Natsuhi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La mattina di Natsuhi cominciava sempre in quella dormiveglia confusa.
Turkish (TR): ......Bu belirsiz uyanma hissi Natsuhi'nin her zamanki sabah deneyimiydi.

Steam (ST): She always slept lightly, and she couldn't sleep at all without medicine. ...To Natsuhi, sleep was definitely not a happy thing.
Umineko Project (UP): Her sleep was always light, and she wouldn't even have been able to sleep at all without medicine.{n}...To Natsuhi, sleeping was definitely not a happy thing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her sleep was always light, and she wouldn't even have been able to sleep at all without medicine....To Natsuhi, sleeping was definitely not a happy thing.
PC Japanese (JP): 眠りはいつも浅く、薬に頼らなくてはそれすら至れない。…夏妃にとって、眠りは決して甘美なものではなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 眠りはいつも浅く、薬に頼らなくてはそれすら至れない。{n}…夏妃にとって、眠りは決して甘美なものではなかった。
Russian (RU): У неё всегда был неглубокий сон, и она совершенно не могла спать без снотворного.{n}...Стоит ли и говорить, что сон для Нацухи не был чем‐то приятным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu sono era sempre leve, e ela não seria capaz de dormir de forma alguma sem tomar seus remédios.{n}...Para Natsuhi, dormir certamente não era algo agradável.
Vietnamese (VI): Her sleep was always light, and she wouldn't even have been able to sleep at all without medicine.{n}...To Natsuhi, sleeping was definitely not a happy thing.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的睡眠一直很淺，要是不靠藥，就連這樣的睡眠都達不到。{n}…對夏妃來說，她的睡眠絕對算不上香甜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的睡眠一直很浅，要是不靠药，就连这样的睡眠都达不到。{n}…对夏妃来说，她的睡眠绝对算不上香甜。
Indonesian (IDN): She always slept lightly, and she couldn't sleep at all without medicine. ...To Natsuhi, sleep was definitely not a happy thing.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il suo sonno era sempre leggero, e non sarebbe stata capace di dormire del tutto senza medicine. ... Per Natsuhi, dormire era decisamente una cosa infelice.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il suo sonno era costantemente leggero, e senza le sue medicine non sarebbe neanche riuscita in ciò... Per Natsuhi, prendere sonno non era mai fonte di gioia.
Turkish (TR): Uykusu her zaman hafifti ve ilaç olmadan hiç uyuyamazdı bile.{n}...Natsuhi için uyumak kesinlikle mutlu bir şey değildi.

Steam (ST): When she looked outside, she saw that it was still pouring. If she hadn't sensed a tiny amount of light, she might have mistakenly thought that it was still the previous night.
Umineko Project (UP): When she looked outside, she saw that it was still pouring.{n}If she hadn't sensed a tiny amount of light, she might have mistakenly thought that it was still last night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When she looked outside, she saw that it was still pouring. If she hadn't sensed a tiny amount of light, she might have mistakenly thought that it was still last night.
PC Japanese (JP): 外を見れば相変わらずの大雨。わずかばかりの明るさが感じられなければ、未だに昨夜が続いているのではと勘違いするほどだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 外を見れば相変わらずの大雨。{n}わずかばかりの明るさが感じられなければ、未だに昨夜が続いているのではと勘違いするほどだった。
Russian (RU): Посмотрев в окно, она увидела, что дождь продолжает лить.{n}Если бы она не почувствовала хоть немного света, то ошибочно предположила бы, что на дворе ещё ночь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao olhar pela janela, viu que ainda estava chovendo.{n}Se não tivesse visto uma pequena quantidade de luz, poderia até se enganar pensando que ainda era noite passada.
Vietnamese (VI): When she looked outside, she saw that it was still pouring.{n}If she hadn't sensed a tiny amount of light, she might have mistakenly thought that it was still last night.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她看了下外面，依舊是磅礴大雨。{n}要是沒感受到那一絲絲亮光的話，甚至會誤以為昨夜還沒過去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她看了下外面，依旧是磅礴大雨。{n}要是没感受到那一丝丝亮光的话，甚至会误以为昨夜还没过去。
Indonesian (IDN): When she looked outside, she saw that it was still pouring. If she hadn't sensed a tiny amount of light, she might have mistakenly thought that it was still the previous night.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando diede un'occhiata all'esterno, vide che stava ancora piovigginando. {n}Se non avesse percepito un tenue fascio di luce, avrebbe potuto pensare erroneamente che era ancora notte.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Guardando fuori, vide che stava ancora piovendo a dirotto. Se non l'avesse raggiunta un piccolo raggio di luce, avrebbe potuto pensare che fosse ancora la sera del giorno prima...
Turkish (TR): Dışarı baktığında, yağmurun hâlâ yağdığını gördü.{n}Azıcık bir ışık hissetmemiş olsaydı, yanlışlıkla hala gece olduğunu düşünebilirdi.

Steam (ST): ...She herself was one of the hosts, so she mustn't wake up later than her guests.
Umineko Project (UP): ...She herself was one of the hosts, so she mustn't wake up later than her guests.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...She herself was one of the hosts, so she mustn't wake up later than her guests.
PC Japanese (JP): …自分はホスト側の人間なのだから、客人よりも後に起床するわけにはいかない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …自分はホスト側の人間なのだから、客人よりも後に起床するわけにはいかない。
Russian (RU): ...Она была принимающей гостей хозяйкой, поэтому ей не подобало просыпаться позже своих гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ela era um dos anfitriões, então não deveria acordar mais tarde do que os convidados.
Vietnamese (VI): ...She herself was one of the hosts, so she mustn't wake up later than her guests.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …自己是東道主，因此不可以比客人晚起床。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …自己是东道主，因此不可以比客人晚起床。
Indonesian (IDN): ...She herself was one of the hosts, so she mustn't wake up later than her guests.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che lei era la padrona di casa, non poteva destarsi dopo gli ospiti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dato che lei era la padrona di casa, non poteva destarsi dopo gli ospiti.
Turkish (TR): ...Kendisi de ev sahiplerinden biriydi, bu yüzden misafirlerinden daha geç uyanmamalıydı.

Steam (ST): Urging herself on, she raised up her body, which still hadn't completely recovered from yesterday's weariness.
Umineko Project (UP): Urging herself on, she raised up her body, which still hadn't completely recovered from yesterday's weariness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Urging herself on, she raised up her body, which still hadn't completely recovered from yesterday's weariness.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃はそう自分を鞭打ち、疲れの抜け切らない体を起こす。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃はそう自分を鞭打ち、疲れの抜け切らない体を起こす。
Russian (RU): Побуждая себя, она заставила подняться своё всё ещё не до конца оправившееся от вчерашней слабости тело.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Forçando‐se, começou a se levantar, apesar de seu corpo ainda não ter se recuperado do cansaço do dia anterior.
Vietnamese (VI): Urging herself on, she raised up her body, which still hadn't completely recovered from yesterday's weariness.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃強逼著自己，拖起了還未消去疲勞的身軀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃强逼着自己，拖起了还未消去疲劳的身躯。
Indonesian (IDN): Urging herself on, she raised up her body, which still hadn't completely recovered from yesterday's weariness.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Decidendo di affrettarsi, si mise seduta, il corpo non ancora ripresosi completamente dalla stanchezza del giorno prima.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pur non avendo smaltito la stanchezza, Natsuhi si fece forza e si alzò.
Turkish (TR): Kendini zorlayarak, dünün yorgunluğunu hâlâ tam olarak üzerinden atamamış olan bedenini kaldırdı.

Steam (ST): No one would torment her as long as she remained inside this room. And her headache wouldn't get any worse here. ......This room was the only place she could find peace.
Umineko Project (UP): While she was inside this room, no one would torment her.{n}Her headache wouldn't get any worse than it already was.{n}......This room was her only peaceful space.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): While she was inside this room, no one would torment her. Her headache wouldn't get any worse than it already was.......This room was her only peaceful space.
PC Japanese (JP): この部屋にいる内は、誰も彼女を苛まない。頭痛もこれ以上ひどくはならない。……この部屋だけが彼女にとって安らぎの空間だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この部屋にいる内は、誰も彼女を苛まない。{n}頭痛もこれ以上ひどくはならない。{n}……この部屋だけが彼女にとって安らぎの空間だった。
Russian (RU): Когда она находилась в этой комнате, никто не смел издеваться над ней.{n}Её головная боль не станет хуже, чем она уже есть.{n}......Эта комната была её единственной тихой гаванью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto estivesse nesse quarto, ninguém a atormentaria.{n}Sua dor de cabeça não pioraria mais do que já estava.{n}......Esse quarto era seu único local pacífico.
Vietnamese (VI): While she was inside this room, no one would torment her.{n}Her headache wouldn't get any worse than it already was.{n}......This room was her only peaceful space.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這間房間裡，誰都不會去苛責她。{n}頭痛也不會變得更厲害。{n}……只有這間房間，對她來說才算得上是一方淨土。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这间房间里，谁都不会去苛责她。{n}头痛也不会变得更厉害。{n}……只有这间房间，对她来说才算得上是一方净土。
Indonesian (IDN): No one would torment her as long as she remained inside this room. And her headache wouldn't get any worse here. ......This room was the only place she could find peace.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fintanto che rimaneva dentro la stanza, nessuno l'avrebbe disturbata. Il suo mal di testa non avrebbe potuto peggiorare ulteriormente di quanto non lo fosse già. ... Questa stanza era l'unico angolo pacifico per lei.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Finché sarebbe rimasta nella sua stanza, nessuno l'avrebbe disturbata. Ed il suo mal di testa non avrebbe potuto peggiorare... Questa stanza era l'unico spazio dove poteva sentirsi in pace.
Turkish (TR): Bu odanın içinde olduğu sürece kimse ona eziyet etmeyecekti.{n}Baş ağrısı olduğundan daha da kötüleşmeyecekti.{n}......Bu oda onun tek huzurlu alanıydı.

Steam (ST): So when she left, it meant returning to the world where her husband's siblings kept trying to stab each other in the back.
Umineko Project (UP): So when she left, it meant returning to the world of her husbands' siblings probing each others' minds.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So when she left, it meant returning to the world of her husbands' siblings probing each others' minds.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、ここを出れば夫の兄弟たちとの腹の探りあいの世界に戻ることになる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だから、ここを出れば夫の兄弟たちとの腹の探りあいの世界に戻ることになる。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, её оставление означало возвращение в мир брата и сестёр её мужа, пытающихся угадать мысли друг друга.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sendo assim, sair significava voltar ao mundo onde os irmãos de seu marido cutucavam as feridas uns dos outros.
Vietnamese (VI): So when she left, it meant returning to the world of her husbands' siblings probing each others' minds.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，一旦離開了這裡，也就等於是回到了與丈夫的弟弟妹妹們勾心鬥角的世界之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，一旦离开了这里，也就等于是回到了与丈夫的弟弟妹妹们勾心斗角的世界之中。
Indonesian (IDN): So when she left, it meant returning to the world where her husband's siblings kept trying to stab each other in the back.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò quando lo abbandonava, significava tornare al mondo dei parenti di suo marito, che tentavano di studiarsi le menti l'un l'altro.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò, abbandonarla significava tornare in una realtà in cui i fratelli di suo marito cospiravano tra di loro...
Turkish (TR): Bu yüzden buradan ayrılması, kocasının kardeşlerinin birbirlerinin zihinlerini irdelediği dünyaya geri dönmesi anlamına geliyordu.

Steam (ST): ...In that case, wouldn't it be better to just stay locked up in this room forever...?
Umineko Project (UP): ...Then wouldn't it be better to just stay locked up in this room forever...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Then wouldn't it be better to just stay locked up in this room forever...?
PC Japanese (JP): …ならいっそ、ずっとこの部屋に篭ったままでいられたら…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …ならいっそ、ずっとこの部屋に篭ったままでいられたら…。
Russian (RU): ...Так не было бы лучше навсегда остаться запертой в этой комнате?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Então não seria melhor ficar trancada aqui para sempre...?
Vietnamese (VI): ...Then wouldn't it be better to just stay locked up in this room forever...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …倒不如就一直躲在這房間裡算了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …倒不如就一直躲在这房间里算了…。
Indonesian (IDN): ...In that case, wouldn't it be better to just stay locked up in this room forever...?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Allora non sarebbe stato meglio rimanere chiusa in questa stanza per sempre...?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In tal caso, non sarebbe stato meglio rintanarsi in quella stanza per sempre...?
Turkish (TR): ...O zaman sonsuza dek bu odada kilitli kalmak daha iyi olmaz mıydı...?

Steam (ST): That ridiculous notion brought a bitter smile to Natsuhi's face. ...She was starting to sound like Kinzo.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi smiled bitterly at this fantasy.{n}...She was starting to sound like Kinzo.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi smiled bitterly at this delusion....She was starting to sound like Kinzo.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃はそんな妄想を考え、苦笑した。…これでは、金蔵と同じではないかと。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃はそんな妄想を考え、苦笑した。{n}…これでは、金蔵と同じではないかと。
Russian (RU): Нацухи горько улыбнулась этому заблуждению.{n}...Она начинала звучать совсем как Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi deu um sorriso amargo à sua fantasia.{n}...Ela estava começando a soar como Kinzo.
Vietnamese (VI): Natsuhi smiled bitterly at this fantasy.{n}...She was starting to sound like Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃如此妄想著，露出了苦笑。{n}…她心想，這不就和金藏一樣了嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃如此妄想着，露出了苦笑。{n}…她心想，这不就和金藏一样了吗？
Indonesian (IDN): That ridiculous notion brought a bitter smile to Natsuhi's face. ...She was starting to sound like Kinzo.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi sorrise amaramente a quest'illusione. ... Cominciava ad assomigliare a Kinzo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Concependo una tale fantasia, Natsuhi sorrise amaramente... Forse non era tanto diversa da Kinzo...
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi bu fanteziye acı acı gülümsedi.{n}...Kinzo gibi olmaya başlamıştı.

Steam (ST): ...Though she often complained about Kinzo staying locked up in his own room and refusing to attend to everyone else, the truth was that she longed to do the same.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Even though most of the time she would call Kinzo names for staying locked up in his own room and taking no notice of anyone, the truth was that she actually longed to do so herself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Even though most of the time she would carelessly call Kinzo names for staying locked up in his own room, the truth was that she actually longed to do so herself.
PC Japanese (JP): …普段は、自分たちを顧みず自室に篭る金蔵に悪態を付いておきながら、実はそれに憧れている矛盾。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …普段は、自分たちを顧みず自室に篭る金蔵に悪態を付いておきながら、実はそれに憧れている矛盾。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Apesar de repreender Kinzo na maior parte do tempo por se trancar no próprio quarto sem se importar com os outros, a verdade é que Natsuhi ansiava em fazer o mesmo.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽然平时对不管家人只知道把自己关在书房里的金藏颇有怨言，但其实自己也憧憬于可以那样，真是矛盾。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... E sebbene il più delle volte rimproverasse con noncuranza Kinzo, poiché se ne stava chiuso nel suo studio, la verità era che lei stessa desiderava fare la stessa cosa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E sebbene normalmente maledicesse Kinzo, il quale era chiuso nel suo studio senza curarsi degli altri, la verità era che desiderava fare lo stesso...

Steam (ST): When she reached for the doorknob, trying to leave the room, her hand touched the scorpion charm that she had hung from it before going to sleep the previous night.

Steam (ST): Then Natsuhi remembered. That's right, last night, I promised Jessica that I'd give her a charm of my own in exchange for this one, didn't I?
Umineko Project (UP): Then Natsuhi remembered.{n}That's right, last night, I promised Jessica that I would give her a charm of my own in exchange for this one, didn't I?

PC Japanese (JP): そこで夏妃は思い出す。そうだ、昨夜、朱志香に、このお守りの代わりに自分のお守りをあげようと約束したんだっけ。

Steam (ST): She had heard that this was a spiritual mirror for warding off evil spirits, and she had been given it specially by her Grandmother when her Grandfather's mementos had been distributed.
Umineko Project (UP): She had heard that this mirror was a spiritual mirror to ward off evil spirits, and she had been given it specially by her grandmother when her grandfather's mementos had been distributed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had heard that this mirror was a spiritual mirror to ward off evil spirits, and she had been given it specially by her Grandmother when her grandfather's mementos had been distributed.
PC Japanese (JP): この鏡は魔除けの霊鏡だそうで、祖父の形見分けの時に祖母から特にと贈られたものだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この鏡は魔除けの霊鏡だそうで、祖父の形見分けの時に祖母から特にと贈られたものだ。
Russian (RU): Ей рассказывали, что это было духовное зеркало, призванное отгонять злых духов, и досталось оно ей специально от её бабушки, когда распределялись оставшиеся после смерти её дедушки вещи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela tinha ouvido que esse espelho tinha poderes espirituais de espantar espíritos malignos, e ela o recebeu em especial da sua avó quando os bens do seu avô foram distribuídos.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據說這鏡子是一面避邪的靈鏡。它是在分發爺爺的遺物時，奶奶特別贈給夏妃的。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Aveva sentito che questo oggetto era uno specchio spirituale per respingere gli spiriti maligni, e le era stato regalato volutamente da sua Nonna quando gli effetti personali del Nonno furono distribuiti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pareva essere uno specchio mistico che proteggeva dagli influssi maligni, e che sua nonna, al momento della distribuzione dei beni del nonno, aveva deciso di cederle.

Steam (ST): It had been believed since long ago that a strange power resided in this mirror. Perhaps people thought it could reflect calamity and malice in the same way it reflected light.
Umineko Project (UP): It has been believed since ancient times that strange powers dwell within mirrors.{n}Most likely, the way they reflect light created a belief that they also deflect misfortune and malice in the same way.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had been believed since long ago that a strange power slept in that mirror. It was believed that, in the same way it reflected light, it also deflected misfortune and malice.
PC Japanese (JP): 鏡には不思議な力が宿ると古来より信じられている。光を跳ね返すその様から、災厄や悪意をも跳ね返すと信じられたのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 鏡には不思議な力が宿ると古来より信じられている。{n}光を跳ね返すその様から、災厄や悪意をも跳ね返すと信じられたのだろう。
Russian (RU): Давным‐давно люди верили, что в зеркалах спит странная сила.{n}Наиболее вероятно, отражение солнечных лучей стало поводом для поверья, что зеркало также отражает беды и злобу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Desde tempos antigos se acreditava que poderes estranhos residiam em espelhos. Muito provavelmente, o jeito que eles refletem a luz originou a crença de que eles também desviavam o azar e a malícia.
Vietnamese (VI): It has been believed since ancient times that strange powers dwell within mirrors.{n}Most likely, the way they reflect light created a belief that they also deflect misfortune and malice in the same way.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自古以來人們就相信鏡子中宿有神秘的力量。{n}是因為鏡子能夠反射光，所以人們便相信，它可以同樣把災厄與惡意給反射回去吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自古以来人们就相信镜子中宿有神秘的力量。{n}是因为镜子能够反射光，所以人们便相信，它可以同样把灾厄与恶意给反射回去吧。
Indonesian (IDN): It had been believed since long ago that a strange power resided in this mirror. Perhaps people thought it could reflect calamity and malice in the same way it reflected light.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si credette per molto tempo che in quello specchio si celasse uno strano potere. Si credeva anche che, nello stesso modo in cui rifletteva la luce, respingeva anche la sfortuna e la malvagità.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Fin dall'antichità, si riteneva che in esso si celasse un misterioso potere.{n}Forse credevano che potesse respingere la sventura e la malvagità, nello stesso modo in cui respingeva la luce.
Turkish (TR): Eski zamanlardan beri aynaların içinde garip güçlerin yaşadığına inanılırdı.{n}Büyük olasılıkla ışığı yansıtma biçimleri, talihsizliği ve kötülüğü de aynı şekilde saptırdıklarına dair bir inanç yaratmıştı.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi returned the mirror to its pouch....It would probably be a fitting object to hand over to Jessica.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "Good morning, Madam, it is Genji. My apologies for waking you so early."
Umineko Project (UP): "Good morning, Madam. It is Genji. My apologies for waking you so early."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Good morning, Madam, it is Genji. My apologies for waking you so early."
PC Japanese (JP): 「おはようございます、奥様。源次でございます。早朝から申し訳ございません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「おはようございます、奥様。源次でございます。早朝から申し訳ございません」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bom dia, madame. Sou eu, Genji. Minhas desculpas por acordá‐la tão cedo."
Vietnamese (VI): "Good morning, Madam. It is Genji. My apologies for waking you so early."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「早上好，太太。我是源次。大清早的真是十分抱歉。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「早上好，太太。我是源次。大清早的真是十分抱歉。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Good morning, Madam, it is Genji. My apologies for waking you so early."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Buongiorno, madame. Sono Genji. Mi perdoni per averla svegliata a quest'ora del mattino."
Turkish (TR): "Günaydın, Madam. Ben Genji. Sizi bu kadar erken uyandırdığım için özür dilerim."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Sto arrivando. Cosa c'è?"

Steam (ST): No servant had ever come to her this early in the morning, nor had they come to wake her in person.
Umineko Project (UP): No servant had ever come to her this early in the morning, and especially not directly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No servant had ever come to her this early in the morning, nor had they come to her directly.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 使用人がこのような早朝に、それも直接やって来るなど、これまでにないことだった。

Steam (ST): ...Perhaps something bad had happened. Maybe some fatal oversight had been made while preparing breakfast, something that would shame the household in front of their guests.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Maybe something bad had happened.{n}For example, maybe some fatal oversight had been made during the preparations for breakfast, and the household would be put to shame in front of the guests, or something.

PC Japanese (JP): …何かマズイことでもあったのだろうか。例えば、朝食の準備に致命的な手抜かりがあり、客人たちの前で恥をかくことになる、とか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …何かマズイことでもあったのだろうか。{n}例えば、朝食の準備に致命的な手抜かりがあり、客人たちの前で恥をかくことになる、とか。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Talvez algo de ruim tenha acontecido.{n}Por exemplo, um erro fatal passou despercebido na preparação do café da manhã ou coisa parecida, o que seria um motivo de grande vergonha perante os convidados.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Maybe something bad had happened.{n}For example, maybe some fatal oversight had been made during the preparations for breakfast, and the household would be put to shame in front of the guests, or something.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …是發生了什麼棘手的事嗎？{n}比如在準備早餐時出現了致命性的過失，會在客人們面前丟臉之類的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …是发生了什么棘手的事吗？{n}比如在准备早餐时出现了致命性的过失，会在客人们面前丢脸之类的。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Perhaps something bad had happened. Maybe some fatal oversight had been made while preparing breakfast, something that would shame the household in front of their guests.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Forse era successo qualcosa? Magari era stato commesso qualche grave errore nella preparazione della colazione, che le avrebbe arrecato disonore di fronte agli ospiti...?
Turkish (TR): ...Belki de kötü bir şey olmuştu.{n}Örneğin, belki de kahvaltı hazırlıkları sırasında ölümcül bir dikkatsizlik yapılmış ve ev halkı misafirlerin önünde utanç verici bir duruma düşmüştü.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Well, I suppose he slept in. At any rate, just see to it that someone hurries up and prepares breakfast; I don't care who. ...............Wha-"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ele provavelmente ainda está dormindo. Enfim, não importa quem, mas ande logo e prepare o café da manhã. ...............O qu‐"
Vietnamese (VI): "Most likely he is oversleeping. Anyway, it doesn't matter who does it, just hurry with preparing breakfast. ...............Wha—"

Steam (ST): ...It was an unpleasant sight, as though someone had dipped their fingers in a reddish-black liquid and scratched at the door around the doorknob.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …それは、赤黒い液体を指につけてドアノブの辺りを掻き毟ったような、不快なもの。

Steam (ST): It was probably some sort of awful prank... arranged by some person who wanted to make it look as though they'd tried to force the door with bloody hands.
Umineko Project (UP): As though someone had soaked both of their hands in blood and groped at the door and the knob—like someone had wanted to stage something like that and left this mark as an awful prank.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was as though someone had soaked both of their hands in blood and groped at the door and the knob..., like someone had wanted to stage something like that and left this mark as an awful prank.
PC Japanese (JP): まるで両手を血に浸し、扉やノブを弄ったかのような…、そんな風に演出したくて何者かが残した悪趣味な悪戯だろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): まるで両手を血に浸し、扉やノブを弄ったかのような…、そんな風に演出したくて何者かが残した悪趣味な悪戯だろう。
Russian (RU): Словно кто‐то вымазал обе руки в крови и пытался найти дверь и ручку на ощупь... будто бы кто‐то хотел совершить нечто подобное и оставил отметину в виде ужасного розыгрыша.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se alguém tivesse molhado as mãos em sangue e então tateado a porta e a maçaneta — como se alguém quisesse fazer parecer com que algo assim tivesse acontecido e deixou essas marcas como uma brincadeira de mau gosto.
Vietnamese (VI): As though someone had soaked both of their hands in blood and groped at the door and the knob—like someone had wanted to stage something like that and left this mark as an awful prank.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 簡直像是浸泡過鮮血的雙手，在門和門把手上肆意玩弄似的…這應該是某個想營造出這種效果的人，在此留下的一幕低級趣味的惡作劇吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 简直像是浸泡过鲜血的双手，在门和门把手上肆意玩弄似的…这应该是某个想营造出这种效果的人，在此留下的一幕低级趣味的恶作剧吧。
Indonesian (IDN): It was probably some sort of awful prank... arranged by some person who wanted to make it look as though they'd tried to force the door with bloody hands.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembrava quasi che qualcuno si fosse immerso le mani nel sangue e si fosse appoggiato alla porta e al pomello... come se qualcuno avesse voluto mettere in scena qualcosa di simile e avesse lasciato il segno di quel terribile scherzo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Probabilmente era uno scherzo di cattivo gusto... lasciato da qualcuno che voleva dare l'impressione di aver manomesso la porta con le mani pregne di sangue.

Steam (ST): When she'd heard that Gohda alone was missing, she'd assumed he had slept in or was loafing around somewhere. However, now that she'd learned that several of the relatives were also nowhere to be seen, she began to take a slightly more optimistic view.
Umineko Project (UP): When she had heard that Gohda alone was missing, she had thought that he might have slept in or was loafing around somewhere, but once she heard that several of the relatives were also missing, she began to start thinking a little more optimistically.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When she had heard that Gohda alone was missing, she had thought that he might have slept in or was loafing around somewhere, but once she heard that several of the relatives were also missing, her optimistic way of thinking began to change.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田ひとりだけ姿が見えないと聞いた時は、寝坊したのか、どこかで油を売っているのかと思ったが、親族たちも含めての不在だということになると、もう少し楽観的な考え方に変わって来る。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 郷田ひとりだけ姿が見えないと聞いた時は、寝坊したのか、どこかで油を売っているのかと思ったが、親族たちも含めての不在だということになると、もう少し楽観的な考え方に変わって来る。
Russian (RU): Когда Нацухи услышала, что пропал только Года, то подумала, что он мог проспать или просто где‐то болтается, но поскольку она также узнала об исчезновении ещё нескольких родственников, она стала думать несколько более оптимистично.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao ouvir que apenas Gohda estava desaparecido, ela pensou que ele poderia ainda estar dormindo ou vadiando em algum lugar, mas assim que ouviu que diversos parentes também estavam desaparecidos, começou a pensar de maneira um pouco mais otimista.
Vietnamese (VI): When she had heard that Gohda alone was missing, she had thought that he might have slept in or was loafing around somewhere, but once she heard that several of the relatives were also missing, she began to start thinking a little more optimistically.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然在聽到鄉田一個人不見的時候，夏妃還以為他要麼是睡過頭，要麼就是去哪裡偷懶了，但若是連親戚們都不見踪影的話，那麼思路也就能變得稍微樂觀一些了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然在听到乡田一个人不见的时候，夏妃还以为他要么是睡过头，要么就是去哪里偷懒了，但若是连亲戚们都不见踪影的话，那么思路也就能变得稍微乐观一些了。
Indonesian (IDN): When she'd heard that Gohda alone was missing, she'd assumed he had slept in or was loafing around somewhere. However, now that she'd learned that several of the relatives were also nowhere to be seen, she began to take a slightly more optimistic view.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando aveva sentito che solo Gohda mancava, aveva pensato che magari avesse dormito troppo o che stesse oziando in giro, ma una volta appreso che anche buona parte dei fratelli erano spariti, il suo modo di pensare positivo cominciò a cambiare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Nel sentire che Gouda fosse sparito, aveva pensato che magari avesse dormito troppo o che stesse bighellonando altrove, ma il fatto che fossero scomparsi anche i parenti la fece ragionare in un'ottica un po' più ottimista.
Turkish (TR): Sadece Gohda'nın kayıp olduğunu duyduğunda, uyuyakalmış ya da bir yerlerde aylak aylak dolaşıyor olabileceğini düşünmüştü, ama akrabalarından birkaçının da kayıp olduğunu duyunca biraz daha optimistik düşünmeye başladı.

Steam (ST): Could last night's family conference have continued all night, up until the present moment?
Umineko Project (UP): Last night's family conference might have continued all night, and in fact might still be going on.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Could last night's family conference have continued all night and still be going on?

Steam (ST): If so, they might have wanted to cool their heads after being shut in a stuffy room, going out for walks on their own through the rain.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was also imaginable that they had wanted to cool off their heads after being in that stuffy room, and had all gone off on their own walks through the rain.
PC Japanese (JP): それで、部屋の空気も澱んできたので、頭を冷やそう等ということになり、この雨の中、ぞろぞろと散歩に出ている可能性も考えられた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それで、部屋の空気も澱んできたので、頭を冷やそう等ということになり、この雨の中、ぞろぞろと散歩に出ている可能性も考えられた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seria compreensível que eles quisessem refrescar suas cabeças depois de ficarem naquele cômodo abafado, e foram dar uma caminhada em grupo pela chuva.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 有可能是因為房間裡的空氣已經過於渾濁，為了冷靜一下頭腦，他們一行人就一起去雨中散步了。

Indonesian (IDN): If so, they might have wanted to cool their heads after being shut in a stuffy room, going out for walks on their own through the rain.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È anche possibile che abbiano voluto schiarirsi le idee dopo essere stati in quella stanza opprimente, e che se ne siano andati tutti per la loro strada in mezzo alla pioggia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pertanto, si poteva supporre che l'aria ristagnante della stanza li avesse convinti a distendere i nervi, e che fossero usciti insieme per una passeggiata sotto la pioggia...
Turkish (TR): Bu durumda, o havasız odada kaldıktan sonra hepsi kafalarını boşaltmak istemiş, ve yağmur altında grup halinde yürüyüşe çıkmış olabilecekleri düşünülebilirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): Probably, Gohda had been called to go with them to aid them with something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Probably, Gohda had been called to go with them to aid them with something.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 大概乡田也是因为有什么事需要他服务，而被叫去同行了吧。

Steam (ST): Gohda was not a man who lost track of time. He had to understand that preparations for breakfast would be hindered if he did not return.
Umineko Project (UP): Gohda was not a man who lost track of time.{n}He had to have understood that, if he did not return, the preparations for breakfast would be hindered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gohda was not a man who lost track of time. He had to have understood that, if he did not return, the preparations for breakfast would be hindered.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は時間を忘れる男ではない。もう戻らなければ朝食の準備に差し支えるとわかっているに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 郷田は時間を忘れる男ではない。{n}もう戻らなければ朝食の準備に差し支えるとわかっているに違いない。
Russian (RU): Года был не из тех, кто теряет чувство времени.{n}И он должен был понимать, что если он вовремя не вернётся, то приготовление завтрака может затянуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda não era um homem que perdia a noção do tempo.{n}Ele deveria saber que, se não voltasse, os preparativos do café da manhã seriam prejudicados.
Vietnamese (VI): Gohda was not a man who lost track of time.{n}He had to have understood that, if he did not return, the preparations for breakfast would be hindered.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄉田是個不會忘記時間的男人。{n}他一定明白，若是再不回來，肯定會影響到準備早餐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田是个不会忘记时间的男人。{n}他一定明白，若是再不回来，肯定会影响到准备早餐。
Indonesian (IDN): Gohda was not a man who lost track of time. He had to understand that preparations for breakfast would be hindered if he did not return.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Gohda non era tipo da perdere la cognizione del tempo. Doveva aver capito che, se non fosse tornato, avrebbe ostacolato la preparazione della colazione.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Gouda non era una persona che perdeva la cognizione del tempo. Doveva aver capito che, se non fosse tornato al più presto, avrebbe sicuramente ostacolato i preparativi per la colazione.
Turkish (TR): Gohda zamanın nasıl geçtiğini anlayamayacak bir adam değildi.{n}Geri dönmezse kahvaltı hazırlıklarının aksayacağını anlamış olmalıydı.

Steam (ST): However, maybe the family conference had continued until this very moment... with an atmosphere that would make it hard for anyone to slip out.
Umineko Project (UP): So perhaps, as much as he'd like to leave, the atmosphere would not permit him to, and the conference was continuing in that manner even this very moment.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even so, there had been that inescapable atmosphere, so maybe that conference had continued to this very moment.
PC Japanese (JP): にもかかわらず、抜け出せないような雰囲気で、今この瞬間も会議が続いているのではないか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): にもかかわらず、抜け出せないような雰囲気で、今この瞬間も会議が続いているのではないか。
Russian (RU): В таком случае, возможно и несмотря на его желание уйти, обстоятельства этого не позволяли, а ведь собрание вполне могло продолжаться даже в этот самый момент.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então talvez, por mais que quisesse sair, o ânimo do grupo não o permitia, e a conferência continuava assim até agora.
Vietnamese (VI): So perhaps, as much as he'd like to leave, the atmosphere would not permit him to, and the conference was continuing in that manner even this very moment.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但儘管如此，是不是會議直至這一時刻也一直在持續，鄉田由於氣氛使然沒法溜走，而不得不留在了他們身邊呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但尽管如此，是不是会议直至这一时刻也一直在持续，乡田由于气氛使然没法溜走，而不得不留在了他们身边呢？
Indonesian (IDN): However, maybe the family conference had continued until this very moment... with an atmosphere that would make it hard for anyone to slip out.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche così, c'era stata quell'inevitabile atmosfera, quindi forse la riunione stava continuando fino a quel preciso istante.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ciononostante, forse la riunione di famiglia era tutt'ora in corso... e l'atmosfera lì presente gli rendeva impossibile andarsene...
Turkish (TR): Belki de her ne kadar ayrılmak istese de ortam buna izin vermiyordu, ve konferans şu anda bile bu şekilde devam ediyordu.

Steam (ST): ...Yes, that theory would be quite convincing for Natsuhi.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Yes, Natsuhi thought this to be an extremely persuasive theory.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I see, thought Natsuhi. To her, this was an extremely persuasive theory.
PC Japanese (JP): ……なるほど、それは夏妃にとって、非常に説得力のある想像だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……なるほど、それは夏妃にとって、非常に説得力のある想像だった。
Russian (RU): ......Понятно, подумала Нацухи. Эта теория показалась ей достаточно убедительной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sim, Natsuhi pensou que era uma teoria extremamente plausível.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……原来如此，这对夏妃来说是非常有说服力的想法。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Capisco, pensò Natsuhi, era una teoria estremamente convincente.
Turkish (TR): ......Evet, Natsuhi bunun son derece ikna edici bir teori olduğunu düşündü.

Steam (ST): She remembered the illusion she'd felt that morning, as though the previous night had never ended. ...When she learned that the feeling wasn't just an illusion, she once again took a deep, weary breath.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi remembered the illusion that she had felt that morning of being sucked into a continuation of the previous night, ...and upon learning that the feeling wasn't just an illusion, she once again let out a deep, weary breath.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi remembered the illusion that she had felt that morning of being sucked into a continuation of the previous night. ...When she learned that the feeling wasn't just an illusion, she once again took a deep, weary breath.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は今朝、目を覚ました時、昨夜がまだ続いているような錯覚に陥ったことを思い出し、…それが決して錯覚ではなかったことを知り、再びうんざりとした溜め息を漏らす。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃は今朝、目を覚ました時、昨夜がまだ続いているような錯覚に陥ったことを思い出し、…それが決して錯覚ではなかったことを知り、再びうんざりとした溜め息を漏らす。
Russian (RU): Нацухи вспомнилась пережитая ею иллюзия того, словно утро стало продолжением той ночи. ...Когда же она поняла, что эта иллюзия оказалась реальностью, то вновь сделала глубокий усталый вдох.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi lembrou‐se da ilusão que havia sentido naquela manhã de ser sugada numa continuação da noite passada...e, ao descobrir que a sensação não era apenas uma ilusão, ela mais uma vez deu um suspiro profundo e cansado.
Vietnamese (VI): Natsuhi remembered the illusion that she had felt that morning of being sucked into a continuation of the previous night, ...and upon learning that the feeling wasn't just an illusion, she once again let out a deep, weary breath.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃想起了今天早上醒來時，那股昨晚似乎還在持續著的錯覺，…知道這絕不是錯覺後，她再次厭煩地嘆了一口氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃想起了今天早上醒来时，那股昨晚似乎还在持续着的错觉，…知道这绝不是错觉后，她再次厌烦地叹了一口气。
Indonesian (IDN): She remembered the illusion she'd felt that morning, as though the previous night had never ended. ...When she learned that the feeling wasn't just an illusion, she once again took a deep, weary breath.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi ricordò l'illusione che aveva avuto quella mattina di esser stata risucchiata in una continuazione della sera prima. ... Quando aveva compreso che quella sensazione non era solo un'illusione, fece ancora un profondo, estenuante respiro.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Natsuhi ricordò il miraggio in cui era piombata in quella mattina, al momento del suo risveglio, dove la notte precedente sembrava non essersi ancora conclusa... Quando comprese che non era affatto un miraggio, sospirò sconsolata un'altra volta.
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi, sabah bir önceki gecenin içine çekildiği yanılsamasını hatırladı ...ve bu hissin sadece bir yanılsama olmadığını anlayınca bir kez daha derin ve bitkin bir nefes aldı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "......Perhaps they are still discussing the inheritance somewhere in the garden, or maybe the beach. ...At any rate, if we don't call Gohda back, we'll never be able to begin preparations for breakfast."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Most likely, they are still repeating that same discussion about the inheritance somewhere in the garden, or maybe the beach. ...In any case, we must call Gohda back, or we will never be able to complete the preparations for breakfast."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Perhaps they are still repeating that same discussion about the inheritance somewhere in the garden, or maybe the beach. ...Anyway, if we don't call Gohda back, we'll never be able to begin preparations for breakfast."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……大方、庭園のどこか、あるいは海岸の方で相も変わらず遺産の話を繰り返しているのでしょう。…とにかく、郷田を呼び戻さなくては、いつまでも朝食の準備が整いません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……大方、庭園のどこか、あるいは海岸の方で相も変わらず遺産の話を繰り返しているのでしょう。…とにかく、郷田を呼び戻さなくては、いつまでも朝食の準備が整いません」
Russian (RU): "......Очень вероятно, они всё ещё продолжают обсуждать наследство где‐нибудь в саду или, возможно, на пляже. ...В любом случае, если мы не вернём Году, то ни за что не сможем начать приготовления к завтраку."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Provavelmente ainda estão repetindo a mesma discussão sobre a herança em algum lugar do jardim ou talvez até na praia. ...De qualquer forma, devemos chamar o Gohda ou nunca terminaremos os preparativos para o café da manhã."
Vietnamese (VI): "......Most likely, they are still repeating that same discussion about the inheritance somewhere in the garden, or maybe the beach. ...In any case, we must call Gohda back, or we will never be able to complete the preparations for breakfast."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我想他們應該還在庭園的某處，或者是海岸邊上談著遺產的事吧。…總之，若是不把鄉田叫回來，那等多久都沒法開始準備早餐。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我想他们应该还在庭园的某处，或者是海岸边上谈着遗产的事吧。…总之，若是不把乡田叫回来，那等多久都没法开始准备早餐。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Perhaps they are still discussing the inheritance somewhere in the garden, or maybe the beach. ...At any rate, if we don't call Gohda back, we'll never be able to begin preparations for breakfast."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Forse stanno ripetendo la stessa discussione sull'eredità da qualche parte in giardino, o magari in spiaggia. ... In ogni caso, se non chiamiamo indietro Gohda, non potremo mai cominciare i preparativi per la colazione."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Forse sono tornati a discutere sull'eredità da qualche parte nel giardino, oppure in spiaggia... Ad ogni modo, se non richiamiamo Gouda, non termineremo mai i preparativi per la colazione."
Turkish (TR): "......Büyük olasılıkla bahçede ya da belki de sahilde bir yerlerde hala mirasla ilgili aynı tartışmayı tekrarlıyorlardır. ...Her halükarda Gohda'yı geri çağırmalıyız, yoksa kahvaltı hazırlıklarını asla tamamlayamayacağız."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "So what're you sayin'? ...Are Nii-san and the rest still continuin' their discussion...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "So what're you sayin'? ...Are Nii‐san and the rest still continuin' their discussion...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So what're you sayin'? ...Are Nii-san and the rest still continuin' their discussion...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ってことは何や。…兄さんたちの話し合いはまだ続いとるんか…！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ってことは何や。…兄さんたちの話し合いはまだ続いとるんか…！」

Steam (ST): She had planned to say it in a small voice, but Hideyoshi overheard Natsuhi and managed to grasp the situation.
Umineko Project (UP): She had thought she'd spoken in a small voice, but Hideyoshi had overheard her, and managed to grasp the situation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had planned to say it in a small voice, but Hideyoshi overheard Natsuhi, and managed to grasp the situation.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 小声で言ったつもりだったが、夏妃のそれは秀吉に聞かれ、状況を把握されてしまったようだった。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Nii-san and Rudolf sure are tough. Maybe it's just youth in Rosa's case? ......Just a bit after midnight, the two of us were so tired that we headed back to bed, though I do remember that Nii-san and the rest were still having a heated discussion at that point. ......Men certainly are unpleasant when they get all fired up."
Umineko Project (UP): "Nii‐san and Rudolf sure are tough. And maybe it's just youth in Rosa's case? ......The two of us were so tired that we had to go back to bed just after midnight. I do remember that Nii‐san and the rest were still having a heated discussion at that point. ......Men sure are nasty when they get excited."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Nii-san and Rudolf sure are tough. Maybe it's just youth in Rosa's case? ......The two of us were so tired that we had to go back to bed just after midnight. I do remember that Nii-san and the rest were still having a heated discussion at that point. ......Men sure are nasty when they get excited."
PC Japanese (JP): 「兄さんも留弗夫もタフねぇ。楼座の場合は若さかしら？　……私たち、昨夜の２４時過ぎにはもう眠くてベッドに戻らせてもらったんだけど。確かにあの時点でもまだ兄さんたちは熱論を交わしてたわ。……男って熱くなると嫌ぁねぇ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「兄さんも留弗夫もタフねぇ。楼座の場合は若さかしら？　……私たち、昨夜の２４時過ぎにはもう眠くてベッドに戻らせてもらったんだけど。確かにあの時点でもまだ兄さんたちは熱論を交わしてたわ。……男って熱くなると嫌ぁねぇ」
Russian (RU): "Нии‐сан и Рудольф точно крепкие орешки. А в случае с Розой, я думаю, это юность? ......Мы вдвоём настолько вымотались, что вернулись в постель сразу после полуночи. Я помню, что нии‐сан и остальные к этому времени ещё что‐то очень бурно обсуждали. ......Мужчины бывают просто непереносимы, когда взволнованы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O nii‐san e o Rudolf são mesmo resistentes. E talvez para Rosa seja a idade? ......Nós dois estávamos tão cansados que fomos direto para a cama logo depois da meia‐noite. Me lembro que o nii‐san e os outros ainda estavam discutindo fervorosamente naquela hora. ......Homens são mesmo sórdidos quando se animam."
Vietnamese (VI): "Nii‐san and Rudolf sure are tough. And maybe it's just youth in Rosa's case? ......The two of us were so tired that we had to go back to bed just after midnight. I do remember that Nii‐san and the rest were still having a heated discussion at that point. ......Men sure are nasty when they get excited."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哥和留弗夫也真頑強呢。至於樓座，是因為年輕吧？……我們昨晚過了二十四點就困得上床睡覺去了。確實那時候哥他們還在熱烈討論著呢。……男人起勁起來可真是討厭啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哥和留弗夫也真顽强呢。至于楼座，是因为年轻吧？……我们昨晚过了二十四点就困得上床睡觉去了。确实那时候哥他们还在热烈讨论着呢。……男人起劲起来可真是讨厌啊。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Nii-san and Rudolf sure are tough. Steam (ST): The study had an autolock and couldn't be unlocked as long as Kinzo forbade entrance.
Umineko Project (UP): The study would always lock itself, and couldn't be unlocked as long as Kinzo forbade entrance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The study would always lock itself, and couldn't be unlocked as long as Kinzo forbade entrance.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 書斎の扉は常にオートロックで施錠されていて、金蔵が入室を許さない限り開錠されない。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 書房的門一直都上著自動鎖，若非得到金藏的允許，鎖是不會打開的。

Steam (ST): However, since Genji was especially trusted by Kinzo, he was allowed to carry a key to that door...
Umineko Project (UP): However, since Genji was especially trusted by Kinzo, he was allowed to carry a key to that door...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, since Genji was especially trusted by Kinzo, he was allowed to carry a key to that door...
PC Japanese (JP): だが、源次だけは金蔵の特別の信頼を得ていて、扉の鍵を持つことが許されていたのである…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "But if this key is used, won't you also receive the blame...?"

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "......When the Master is sleeping deeply, simply knocking on the door will not suffice.
Umineko Project (UP): "......When the Master is sleeping deeply, simple knocking on the door may not reach his ears."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......When the master is sleeping deeply, simple knocking on the door will not reach his ears.
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お館様は、深くお休みになられている時は、扉を叩くくらいではお耳に届かないこともございます。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お館様は、深くお休みになられている時、扉を叩くくらいではお耳に届かないこともございます」
Russian (RU): "......Когда господин крепко спит, то простой стук в дверь может не достичь его ушей."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Quando o Mestre está dormindo profundamente, meramente bater na porta pode não alcançar seus ouvidos."
Vietnamese (VI): "......When the Master is sleeping deeply, simple knocking on the door may not reach his ears."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……老爺在睡得很熟的時候，區區敲門聲，時而是傳不到他耳中的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……老爷在睡得很熟的时候，区区敲门声，时而是传不到他耳中的。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......When the Master is sleeping deeply, simply knocking on the door will not suffice.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Quando il Padrone dorme profondamente, il semplice bussare sulla porta non raggiunge le sue orecchie.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Quando il padrone dorme profondamente, spesso non sente chi bussa..."
Turkish (TR): "......Efendi derin bir uykudayken, kapıyı çalmak onun kulaklarına ulaşmayabilir."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): ...And it would be more difficult to persuade the Master to leave his room if you must talk through the door. Please use this..."
Umineko Project (UP): "...And when persuading the Master to leave his room, it would be more difficult if you must talk through the door. Please use it..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And when persuading the master to leave his room, it would be more difficult if you must talk through the door. Please use it..."
PC Japanese (JP): …それに、お館様にお部屋を出ていただくよう説得するには、扉越しでは難しゅうございましょう。ぜひお使い下さい…。」

Steam (ST): Until now, Natsuhi had thought of Genji as a cold servant who wouldn't do anything for her, since he worked directly under Kinzo.
Umineko Project (UP): Until now, Natsuhi had thought of Genji as a cold servant who worked directly under Kinzo, and would never work for her.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃はこれまで源次のことを、金蔵直属で自分に仕えることはない冷たい使用人と思ってきた。

Steam (ST): But it looked like she would have to alter her understanding of him...
