Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Well then, you must bring Father with you, okay? After all, it's his son's precious wife who's asking. I'm sure he'll listen to you. *giggle*giggle*giggle* We're guests, so we'll just relax here at our leisure."
Umineko Project (UP): "Be sure you bring Father with you, then, okay? After all, it's his son's darling wife who's asking. I'm sure he'll listen to you. *giggle*giggle*. We are guests, so let us leisurely relax here."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Then, you must bring Father with you, right? After all, it's his son's cute wife who's asking. I'm sure he'll listen to you. *giggle* *giggle* *giggle*. We are guests, so let us leisurely relax here."
PC Japanese (JP): 「じゃあ、お父様を必ず連れてきてね？　息子の可愛い嫁の言うことですもの。きっと聞いてくれるわよ。くすくすくす。私たちは客人だから、ここでのんびりくつろがせてもらうわぁ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「じゃあ、お父様を必ず連れてきてね？　息子の可愛い嫁の言うことですもの。きっと聞いてくれるわよ。くすくすくす。私たちは客人だから、ここでのんびりくつろがせてもらうわぁ」
Russian (RU): "Тогда ты ведь приведёшь с собой отца, не так ли? В конце концов, ведь его будет просить сама милая жёнушка его сына. Я уверена, что он послушает тебя. Хи‐хи‐хи. Мы же гости, так что позволь нам спокойно расслабиться здесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certifique‐se de trazer o pai com você, tudo bem? Afinal, é um pedido da meiga esposa do filho dele. Estou certa de que ele vai te escutar. *risos*. Somos convidados, então nos deixe ficar relaxando aqui."
Vietnamese (VI): "Be sure you bring Father with you, then, okay? After all, it's his son's darling wife who's asking. I'm sure he'll listen to you. *giggle*giggle*. We are guests, so let us leisurely relax here."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那你可一定要把爸帶來哦？畢竟是可愛的兒媳婦嘴裡說出來的話嘛。他肯定會聽的。呵呵呵。我們做客人的，就在這兒舒舒服服地放鬆一會兒了哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那你可一定要把爸带来哦？毕竟是可爱的儿媳妇嘴里说出来的话嘛。他肯定会听的。呵呵呵。我们做客人的，就在这儿舒舒服服地放松一会儿了哦。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Well then, you must bring Father with you, okay? After all, it's his son's precious wife who's asking. I'm sure he'll listen to you. *giggle*giggle*giggle* We're guests, so we'll just relax here at our leisure."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Allora, tu devi portare Papà con te, giusto? Dopotutto, è la graziosa mogliettina di suo figlio che lo sta chiedendo. Sono sicura che ti ascolterà. *giggle* *giggle* *giggle*. Noi siamo ospiti, quindi lasciaci oziare qui."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Allora assicurati di portare qui nostro padre, ok? Dopotutto, glielo sta chiedendo la carissima moglie di suo figlio. Sono sicura che ti ascolterà. Uhuhuhuhuhuh. Visto che noi siamo degli ospiti, resteremo qui ad oziare."
Turkish (TR): "O zaman Babamı da yanında getirdiğinden emin ol, tamam mı? Ne de olsa soran kişi oğlunun sevgili eşi. Eminim seni dinleyecektir. *giggle*giggle*. Biz misafiriz, o yüzden burada rahatça dinlenelim."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "Quit it, Eva, you're takin' this too far. Sorry, Natsuhi nee-san, but we're countin' on you to deal with Father..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Quit it, Eva, you're talkin' too much. Sorry, but Natsuhi nee‐san, we'll leave Father to you..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Quit it, Eva, you're talkin' too much. Sorry, but Natsuhi nee-san? We're counting on you about Father..."

Vietnamese (VI): "Quit it, Eva, you're talkin' too much. Sorry, but Natsuhi nee‐san, we'll leave Father to you..."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Piantala, Eva, stai parlando troppo. Scusala, ma Natsuhi Nee-san? Noi contiamo su di te per Papà..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Finiscila, Eva, stai esagerando. Scusaci, Natsuhi-san, per papà ci affideremo a te..."

Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi left without replying, at a swift pace, her heels clacking loudly with every step.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi, without answering, forcefully spun around on her heels and quickly left that place.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): George-aniki, Jessica and I were snoring loudly on the bed in the cousins' room.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): But Maria, who didn't join in, and who had gone straight to bed the previous night, suddenly and completely opened her eyes.

Umineko Project (UP): As she rubbed her sleepy eyes and looked around, the loud snoring coming from the three cousins continued.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As she rubbed her sleepy eyes and looked around, the loud snoring coming from the three cousins continued.

Steam (ST): ...For a while, Maria had to think about what had happened.
Umineko Project (UP): ...For a while, Maria had to think about what had happened.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...For a while, Maria had to think about what had happened.

Umineko Project (UP): Maria left the cousins' room, trying to head to the room that had been arranged for her and her mother.

Umineko Project (UP): Paying no heed to the three who were sleeping soundly, she made a loud slamming sound on the way out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Paying no heed to the three who were sleeping soundly, she made a loud banging sound.

Umineko Project (UP): In response, Battler mumbled and rolled over in his sleep, but it wasn't enough to wake him up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In response, Battler mumbled and rolled over in his sleep, but it wasn't enough to wake him up.

Umineko Project (UP): After a while, Maria returned, once again opening the door with a lively bang.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After a while, Maria returned, once again opening the door with a lively bang.

Steam (ST): Maria kept groaning "uu-uu-" and looking unhappy. She didn't exactly seem lonely because her mother wasn't around. It was more like she was irritated and thrown off balance because her mother wasn't where she'd expected.
Umineko Project (UP): Maria kept groaning "uu‐uu" and looking unhappy.{n}It seemed like she wasn't simply lonely because she couldn't find her mother, but actually unhappy because her mother wasn't in the place she thought she was, and this made her feel like she'd been tricked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria kept groaning 'uu-uu-' and looking unhappy. It seemed like she wasn't simply lonely because she couldn't find her mother, but actually unhappy because her mother wasn't in the place Maria thought she was and this made her feel like she'd been tricked.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は不愉快そうに、うーうー唸り続ける。母の姿が見えなくて寂しいというよりは、いると思っていた場所にいなかったので、肩透かしが不愉快だったという風に見えた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞は不愉快そうに、うーうー唸り続ける。{n}母の姿が見えなくて寂しいというよりは、いると思っていた場所にいなかったので、肩透かしが不愉快だったという風に見えた。
Russian (RU): Мария продолжала укать и выглядела несчастной.{n}По‐видимому, ей было одиноко не просто потому, что она не могла найти свою мать, но скорее ещё и потому, что её матери не было в том месте, в котором Мария ожидала, поэтому она чувствовала себя так, словно её обманули.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria continuou a resmungar "uu‐uu" com uma cara infeliz.{n}Parecia que não estava apenas solitária porque não conseguia achar a mãe, mas estava infeliz porque a mãe não estava onde ela pensou que estivesse, o que a fazia se sentir enganada.
Vietnamese (VI): Maria kept groaning "uu‐uu" and looking unhappy.{n}It seemed like she wasn't simply lonely because she couldn't find her mother, but actually unhappy because her mother wasn't in the place she thought she was, and this made her feel like she'd been tricked.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞顯得很不愉快，嘴裡念叨著嗚嗚。{n}這副樣子看起來，與其說是找不到媽媽而心裡感到孤單，更像是因媽媽沒在自己以為應該在的地方，讓她撲了空才使她那麼不愉快。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚显得很不愉快，嘴里念叨着呜呜。{n}这副样子看起来，与其说是找不到妈妈而心里感到孤单，更像是因妈妈没在自己以为应该在的地方，让她扑了空才使她那么不愉快。
Indonesian (IDN): Maria kept groaning "uu-uu-" and looking unhappy. She didn't exactly seem lonely because her mother wasn't around. It was more like she was irritated and thrown off balance because her mother wasn't where she'd expected.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Maria continuò a gemere ‘uu-uu-’, sembrando triste. Sembrava che, piuttosto che sentirsi sola perché non riusciva a trovare sua Madre, fosse triste perché sua Madre non era dove lei pensava che fosse e in questo modo si sentiva come se la stesse evitando.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Avvilita, Maria continuò a piagnucolare dei ‘uuh, uuh’. Non sembrava sentirsi sola perché non riusciva a trovare sua mamma, ma che fosse turbata dal fatto che sua madre non fosse dove se la sarebbe aspettata.
Turkish (TR): Maria sürekli "uu-uu" diye inliyor ve mutsuz görünüyordu.{n}Görünüşe göre annesini bulamadığı için yalnız değil, aslında annesini sandığı yerde bulamadığı için mutsuzdu ve bu da kendisini kandırılmış gibi hissetmesine neden oluyordu.

Steam (ST): If we could just tell her where her mother was, that alone would probably calm her down. But, unfortunately, we had no way of knowing where Aunt Rosa was, except that she wasn't here.
Umineko Project (UP): If we could have just told her where her mother was, that might have been enough to satisfy her, but unfortunately, as long as we were here, we had no way of finding that out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She might have been satisfied just to hear where her mother was, but unfortunately, as long as Rosa oba-san wasn't here, we had no way of knowing where she was.
PC Japanese (JP): 今どこにいると一言教えてあげられればそれで納得してくれるのかもしれないが、生憎、楼座叔母さんがどこにいるのか、ここにいる以上わかりようもなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 今どこにいると一言教えてあげられればそれで納得してくれるのかもしれないが、生憎、楼座叔母さんがどこにいるのか、ここにいる以上わかりようもなかった。
Russian (RU): Она могла бы успокоиться, просто узнав, где была её мать, но, к сожалению, отсюда мы никак не могли узнать, где она находится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se pudéssemos ter dito onde a mãe dela estava, isso poderia ser o bastante para satisfazê‐la, mas infelizmente, enquanto estivéssemos aqui, não tínhamos como descobrir.
Vietnamese (VI): If we could have just told her where her mother was, that might have been enough to satisfy her, but unfortunately, as long as we were here, we had no way of finding that out.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要是可以三言兩語就告訴她媽媽在哪，說不定她馬上就會安靜下來，可惜，待在這房間裡是不可能知道樓座姑母身在何處的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要是可以三言两语就告诉她妈妈在哪，说不定她马上就会安静下来，可惜，待在这房间里是不可能知道楼座姑母身在何处的。
Indonesian (IDN): If we could just tell her where her mother was, that alone would probably calm her down. But, unfortunately, we had no way of knowing where Aunt Rosa was, except that she wasn't here.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Avrebbe potuto essere rincuorata anche solo sentendosi dire dove era sua Madre, ma sfortunatamente, dato che Rosa oba-san non era qui, non avevamo modo di sapere dove fosse.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Forse sarebbe bastato accennarle dove fosse zia Rosa, ma sfortunatamente, finché saremmo rimasti lì, non avremmo potuto saperlo.
Turkish (TR): Ona annesinin nerede olduğunu söyleyebilseydik, bu onu tatmin etmek için yeterli olabilirdi, ama ne yazık ki, burada olduğumuz sürece bunu öğrenmemizin bir yolu yoktu.

Steam (ST): Maria regained her usual composure so completely, her earlier tantrum now seemed like a lie.

Steam (ST): "...He seemed to be sleeping still, and I could not wake him." ...If she went back downstairs and said something like that, Eva would probably be amused and triumphant.
Umineko Project (UP): ...He was still sleeping, and she couldn't wake him. ...If she returned downstairs saying something like that, Eva would be very amused and triumphant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...He was still sleeping, and she couldn't wake him. ...If she said something like that and returned downstairs, Eva would be very amused and triumphant.
PC Japanese (JP): …まだお休みなようなので、起こせなかった、…等といって下に戻れば、絵羽はさぞや鬼の首を取ったように面白がるだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …まだお休みなようなので、起こせなかった、…等といって下に戻れば、絵羽はさぞや鬼の首を取ったように面白がるだろう。
Russian (RU): ...Он всё ещё спал, а она не могла его разбудить. ...Если она спустится вниз и скажет нечто подобное, то лишь крайне развеселит Еву и будет вынуждена терпеть её ликование.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ele ainda dormia, e ela não conseguia acordá‐lo. ...Se voltasse para o andar de baixo dizendo uma coisa dessas, Eva ficaria bastante feliz e triunfante.
Vietnamese (VI): ...He was still sleeping, and she couldn't wake him. ...If she returned downstairs saying something like that, Eva would be very amused and triumphant.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …要是回到樓下，說些“爸好像還在休息，所以沒去吵醒他”之類的話，…想必繪羽一定會像取了上將首級般得意吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …要是回到楼下，说些“爸好像还在休息，所以没去吵醒他”之类的话，…想必绘羽一定会像取了上将首级般得意吧。
Indonesian (IDN): "...He seemed to be sleeping still, and I could not wake him." ...If she went back downstairs and said something like that, Eva would probably be amused and triumphant.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Lui stava ancora dormendo, e lei non poteva svegliarlo. ... Se avesse detto una cosa del genere e fosse tornata di sotto, Eva sarebbe stata davvero trionfante e divertita.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A quanto pareva, stava ancora dormendo, e non riuscì a svegliarlo... Se fosse tornata di sotto dicendo qualcosa del genere, Eva avrebbe sicuramente gongolato in maniera spocchiosa.
Turkish (TR): ...Hâlâ uyuyordu ve Natsuhi onu uyandıramazdı. ...Eğer böyle bir şey söyleyerek aşağıya dönerse, Eva çok eğlenecek ve zafer kazanacaktı.

Steam (ST): And even putting Eva aside, it was problematic that Kinzo had stayed shut away during this entire once-a-year conference, not even coming down to greet anyone.
Umineko Project (UP): And even aside from the whole Eva issue, there was the problem that yesterday, during this once‐a‐year family conference, he had stayed locked up all day, and had still not come out to greet the guests.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And even if she didn't tell Eva, there was the problem that, during this once a year family conference, he had stayed locked up all day yesterday, and had still not come out to greet the guests.
PC Japanese (JP): それに、絵羽の話は抜きにしても、年に一度の親族会議を、昨日丸々引き篭もり、未だ挨拶さえしていないというのには問題があった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それに、絵羽の話は抜きにしても、年に一度の親族会議を、昨日丸々引き篭もり、未だ挨拶さえしていないというのには問題があった。
Russian (RU): И даже если забыть о Еве, то всё равно остаётся проблема, что на это семейное собрание, случающееся раз в год, Кинзо заперся в кабинете и не пожелал выходить, чтобы поприветствовать гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E mesmo deixando Eva de lado, havia o problema de que ontem, durante a conferência familiar anual, ele havia ficado trancado o dia inteiro, e ainda não havia saído para cumprimentar os convidados.
Vietnamese (VI): And even aside from the whole Eva issue, there was the problem that yesterday, during this once‐a‐year family conference, he had stayed locked up all day, and had still not come out to greet the guests.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且就算不管繪羽，在這一年一度的親族會議上，爸昨天一整天都把自己關在房間裡，連招呼都還沒來和大家打過，這也確實是個問題。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且就算不管绘羽，在这一年一度的亲族会议上，爸昨天一整天都把自己关在房间里，连招呼都还没来和大家打过，这也确实是个问题。
Indonesian (IDN): And even putting Eva aside, it was problematic that Kinzo had stayed shut away during this entire once-a-year conference, not even coming down to greet anyone.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E anche se non l'avesse detto ad Eva, c'era il problema che, durante questa unica conferenza annuale di famiglia, lui non era uscito per tutta la giornata precedente, e non era ancora uscito a dare il benvenuto agli ospiti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E anche tralasciando Eva, c'era il problema che Kinzo, durante la riunione annuale di famiglia dell'anno scorso, era rimasto chiuso per tutto il giorno nelle sue stanze, non uscendo neppure per salutare...
Turkish (TR): Eva meselesi bir yana, yılda bir kez yapılan bu aile konferansında, dün bütün gün kilitli kalması ve konukları selamlamak için hala dışarı çıkmaması problemi vardı.

Steam (ST): ...I wonder if I can convince him myself? Natsuhi readied herself and used the key that she'd borrowed from Genji to open the door...

Steam (ST): Even though she was prepared for the sweet stench, which seemed to eat into one's brain as it poured out the small crack in the door, she couldn't help but grimace.
Umineko Project (UP): A sweet stench that seemed to eat into her brain poured from the narrow opening she had created, and though she was prepared for it, she couldn't help but grimace.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though she was prepared for the sweet stench that seemed to eat into her brain after pouring out through the small crack in the door, she couldn't help but grimace.
PC Japanese (JP): 細く開いた扉から、むわっと溢れ出して来る脳を蝕むような甘い臭いは、覚悟があっても顔をしかめずにはいられないものだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 細く開いた扉から、むわっと溢れ出して来る脳を蝕むような甘い臭いは、覚悟があっても顔をしかめずにはいられないものだった。
Russian (RU): Хоть она и была готова к сладковатому зловонию, словно разъедающему её мозг, после того, как она самую малость приоткрыла дверь, она не смогла подавить желания скривиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um fedor doce que parecia devorar seu cérebro fluiu da pequena brecha que ela havia criado, e apesar de ter se preparado, ela não pôde evitar de fazer uma careta.
Vietnamese (VI): A sweet stench that seemed to eat into her brain poured from the narrow opening she had created, and though she was prepared for it, she couldn't help but grimace.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從微微開啟的門裡，一股腦地溢出了像是會侵蝕大腦一般的甜味。即使是有思想準備的夏妃，也還是不禁皺起眉頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从微微开启的门里，一股脑地溢出了像是会侵蚀大脑一般的甜味。即使是有思想准备的夏妃，也还是不禁皱起眉头。
Indonesian (IDN): Even though she was prepared for the sweet stench, which seemed to eat into one's brain as it poured out the small crack in the door, she couldn't help but grimace.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se si era preparata all'olezzo nauseabondo che sembrava darle alla testa che usciva dalla piccola fessura della porta, non poté fare a meno di fare una smorfia.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): L'odore dolciastro, che fuoriuscì dal piccolo spiraglio aperto e che sembrava corroderle il cervello, la costrinse ad arricciare il naso, anche se si era preparata ad esso.
Turkish (TR): Yarattığı dar açıklıktan beynini kemirecek gibi hissettiren tatlı bir koku yayıldı ve buna hazırlıklı olmasına rağmen yüzünü buruşturmaktan kendini alamadı.

Steam (ST): Thinking that he might still be sleeping, Natsuhi entered the room quietly...
Umineko Project (UP): Thinking that he might still be sleeping, Natsuhi entered the room quietly...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thinking that he might still be sleeping, Natsuhi entered the room quietly...

Vietnamese (VI): Thinking that he might still be sleeping, Natsuhi entered the room quietly...

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pensando che fosse ancora a letto, Natsuhi entrò silenziosamente nella sua stanza, senza fare rumore...
Turkish (TR): Hâlâ uyuyor olabileceğini düşünen Natsuhi sessizce odaya girdi...

Steam (ST): When she did, Kinzo was already awake and looking down out of the window.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "......I didn't get the chance to ask, but they were not inside the study. ...Father would never let them into his room to discuss such a lowly topic, so it is unlikely he knows where they went. Let us go downstairs and wait for the servants to return from their search.
Umineko Project (UP): "......I didn't get the chance to ask, but they were not inside the study. ...Father would never let them into his room to discuss such a lowly topic, so it is unlikely that he knows where they went. Let us go downstairs and wait for the servants to return from their search."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I didn't get the chance to ask, but they were not inside the study. ...Father would never let them into his room to discuss such a lowly topic, so it is unlikely that he knows where they went. Let us go downstairs and wait for the servants to return from their search.
PC Japanese (JP): 「……聞きそびれましたが、書斎の中にはいませんでした。…お父様が、夫たちの下賎な話のために入室を許すこともありえませんから、行き先を知ることもないでしょう。下に降りて、使用人たちが探してくれるのを待ちましょう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……聞きそびれましたが、書斎の中にはいませんでした。…お父様が、夫たちの下賎な話のために入室を許すこともありえませんから、行き先を知ることもないでしょう。下に降りて、使用人たちが探してくれるのを待ちましょう」
Russian (RU): "......У меня не было возможности спросить, но в кабинете их не было. ...Немыслимо, чтобы отец позволил им войти в кабинет для столь низкого разговора, поэтому он в любом случае не мог знать, куда они запропастились. Давай спустимся вниз и дождёмся слуг, чтобы возобновить их поиски."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Não tive a chance de perguntar, mas não estavam dentro do estúdio. ...O pai jamais os deixaria entrarem em seu estúdio para discutir algo de tão baixo calão, então é improvável que saiba para onde tenham ido. Vamos ficar aqui em baixo e esperar os serviçais voltarem de sua busca."
Vietnamese (VI): "......I didn't get the chance to ask, but they were not inside the study. ...Father would never let them into his room to discuss such a lowly topic, so it is unlikely that he knows where they went. Let us go downstairs and wait for the servants to return from their search."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……虽然没找到机会问，但他们不在书房里。…爸是绝不会为了我丈夫他们那些下贱的事而允许他们进房间的，想来也不会知道他们去哪了吧。还是下楼等佣人们去找吧。」

Andiamo giù e aspettiamo che i domestici tornino dalla loro ricerca.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O som de passos veio correndo até eles, fazendo um barulho de tap‐tap.{n}Era apenas um par de passos, então perceberam, antes de ver a origem, de que não se tratava de Krauss e os demais, mas provavelmente de Kanon.
Vietnamese (VI): The sound of footsteps came rushing towards them with a pitter‐patter.{n}There was only one set, so they realized before they saw the source that it was not Krauss and the rest, but probably Kanon.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 一阵“啪嗒啪嗒”的奔跑声，由远至近传来。{n}由于传来的是一个人的跑步声，因此在此人现身之前，就猜得出来这应该不是藏臼他们，而是嘉音。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Si sentì un rumore di passi affrettati. Erano i passi di una sola persona, pertanto realizzarono che probabilmente non fossero quelli di Klaus e gli altri, ma di Kanon, prima ancora che comparisse.
Turkish (TR): Ayak sesleri pıt pıt onlara doğru hızla yaklaşıyordu.{n}Sadece bir kişinin ayak sesi vardı, bu yüzden kaynağını görmeden önce bunun Krauss ve diğerleri değil, muhtemelen sadece Kanon olduğunu anladılar.

Steam (ST): While the children made a big fuss watching television, Kanon and the rest dashed over to the entrance...

Steam (ST): The rose garden storehouse was a place that housed various tools used to manage the garden.
Umineko Project (UP): The rose garden storehouse was a place that housed various tools used to manage the garden.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The rose garden storehouse was a place that housed various tools used to manage the garden.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 薔薇庭園の倉庫は、庭園管理用の様々な園芸道具をしまっているところだった。
Russian (RU): Кладовая в розарии была местом для хранения разнообразных инструментов для ухода за садом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O depósito do jardim de rosas era um local que abrigava diversas ferramentas usadas na manutenção do jardim.
Vietnamese (VI): The rose garden storehouse was a place that housed various tools used to manage the garden.

Steam (ST): It was definitely not a pretty building. Because of its appearance, it had been built so that it was hidden in a corner of the rose garden.
Umineko Project (UP): It was definitely not a pretty building.{n}Because of its appearance, it had been built hidden in a corner of the rose garden.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was definitely not a pretty building. Because of its appearance, it had been built hidden in a corner of the rose garden.
PC Japanese (JP): 決して綺麗な建物ではない。そのため美観的な都合から、薔薇庭園の隅に隠れるように建てられていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 決して綺麗な建物ではない。{n}そのため美観的な都合から、薔薇庭園の隅に隠れるように建てられていた。
Russian (RU): Её определённо нельзя было назвать красивым зданием.{n}Из‐за своего облика она была построена в углу розария, скрытая от глаз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certamente não era uma construção muito bonita.{n}Devido à sua aparência, foi construído escondido em um canto do jardim de rosas.
Vietnamese (VI): It was definitely not a pretty building.{n}Because of its appearance, it had been built hidden in a corner of the rose garden.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它絕對算不上是一棟漂亮的建築物。{n}因此為了整體美觀，它被建在了隱沒於玫瑰庭園的角落裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它绝对算不上是一栋漂亮的建筑物。{n}因此为了整体美观，它被建在了隐没于玫瑰庭园的角落里。
Indonesian (IDN): It was definitely not a pretty building. Because of its appearance, it had been built so that it was hidden in a corner of the rose garden.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non era per nulla un bell'edificio. A causa del suo aspetto, era stato costruito in un angolo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era un edificio decisamente brutto. Pertanto, venne celato in un angolo nascosto del roseto per ragioni d'estetica.
Turkish (TR): Kesinlikle sevimli bir bina değildi.{n}Görünüşü nedeniyle gül bahçesinin bir köşesine gizlenmiş olarak inşa edilmişti.

Steam (ST): Kanon, Genji, Eva, and Hideyoshi came cutting across the rose garden holding umbrellas.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon, Genji, Eva, and Hideyoshi came cutting across the rose garden holding umbrellas.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon, Genji, Eva, and Hideyoshi came cutting across the rose garden holding umbrellas.

Indonesian (IDN): Kanon, Genji, Eva, and Hideyoshi came cutting across the rose garden holding umbrellas.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Kanon, Genji, Eva e Hideyoshi in questo rispettivo ordine, lo raggiunsero tagliando per il roseto, mentre reggevano i loro ombrelli.
Turkish (TR): Kanon, Genji, Eva ve Hideyoshi ellerinde şemsiyelerle gül bahçesinden geçerek geldiler.

Steam (ST): They entered a small path just off the rose garden, which was normally off limits for those appreciating the garden and only used by those maintaining it.
Umineko Project (UP): They entered a small path just off the rose garden, which was not used by those simply appreciating the garden, but only by those maintaining it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They entered a small path just off the rose garden, which was normally off limits for those appreciating the garden and only used by those maintaining the garden.
PC Japanese (JP): 薔薇庭園を抜け、普通に薔薇を鑑賞する人は立ち入らない管理用の小道に入っていく。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 薔薇庭園を抜け、普通に薔薇を鑑賞する人は立ち入らない管理用の小道に入っていく。
Russian (RU): Они вышли на маленькую тропу, отходящую от розария. Любующиеся садом обычно не заходили на неё, и ею пользовались только занимающиеся уходом за садом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Adentraram em um pequeno caminho, próximo à saída do jardim de rosas, que não era usado apenas pelos que apreciavam a beleza do jardim, mas sim pelos que o mantinham.
Vietnamese (VI): They entered a small path just off the rose garden, which was not used by those simply appreciating the garden, but only by those maintaining it.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 跑過庭園後，他們拐入了一條平常觀賞玫瑰的客人不會踏足的，護理庭園專用的小道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 跑过庭园后，他们拐入了一条平常观赏玫瑰的客人不会踏足的，护理庭园专用的小道。
Indonesian (IDN): They entered a small path just off the rose garden, which was normally off limits for those appreciating the garden and only used by those maintaining it.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Seguirono un piccolo percorso poco distante dal giardino delle rose, che di solito era off limits per quelli che ammiravano il giardino ed era usato solo da quelli che se ne prendevano cura.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Seguirono un sentiero adibito al personale che deviava dal giardino di rose, e che normalmente era interdetto agli ammiratori dei fiori.
Turkish (TR): Gül bahçesinin hemen dışındaki küçük bir patikaya girdiler; bu patika sadece bahçenin tadını çıkaranlar tarafından değil, bahçenin bakımını yapanlar tarafından kullanılıyordu.

Steam (ST): As they dashed down that, the storehouse came into view in front of them.
Umineko Project (UP): As they dashed further along it, the front of the storehouse came into view.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As they dashed along that as well, the front of the storehouse came into view.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それをさらに駆け抜けていくと、前方に倉庫が見えてくるのだった。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 再穿过这条小道，便看到了前方的仓库。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Lo percosero sempre più velocemente, finché la facciata del magazzino entrò nel loro campo visivo.
Turkish (TR): Yol boyunca hızla ilerlediklerinde ambarın önü göründü.

Steam (ST): It was quite an old shed, and compared to the flawlessly perfect beauty of the rose garden, it was pretty seedy-looking. It was easy to understand why it had been built in a hard-to-see place.
Umineko Project (UP): It was a very old shed of a storehouse, and compared to the flawlessly perfect beauty of the rose garden, it was pretty seedy‐looking. It was easy to understand why it had been built in a hard‐to‐see place.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a very old shed of a storehouse, and compared to the flawlessly perfect beauty of the rose garden, it was pretty seedy-looking. It was easy to understand why it had been built in a hard to see place.
PC Japanese (JP): それはだいぶ古くなった倉庫小屋で、完全無欠な美しさを誇る薔薇庭園と比べると、あまりに貧相なもので、なるほど、目に付かないような場所にしてあるのも納得できた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それはだいぶ古くなった倉庫小屋で、完全無欠な美しさを誇る薔薇庭園と比べると、あまりに貧相なもので、なるほど、目に付かないような場所にしてあるのも納得できた。
Russian (RU): Это было очень старое строение, и на фоне бесподобного в своей красоте розария оно смотрелось бы как бельмо на глазу. Было несложно понять, почему его построили в столь скрытом от глаз месте.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um galpão velho usado como depósito, e comparado com a beleza perfeitamente sem falhas das rosas, estava bastante desgastado. Era fácil de entender o motivo pelo qual tinha sido construído em um local tão escondido.
Vietnamese (VI): It was a very old shed of a storehouse, and compared to the flawlessly perfect beauty of the rose garden, it was pretty seedy‐looking. It was easy to understand why it had been built in a hard‐to‐see place.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是間相當古舊的倉庫小屋，與以無瑕之美為榮的玫瑰庭園比起來，簡直寒酸得要命。原來如此，怪不得會建在沒人看得到的地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是间相当古旧的仓库小屋，与以无瑕之美为荣的玫瑰庭园比起来，简直寒酸得要命。原来如此，怪不得会建在没人看得到的地方。
Indonesian (IDN): It was quite an old shed, and compared to the flawlessly perfect beauty of the rose garden, it was pretty seedy-looking. It was easy to understand why it had been built in a hard-to-see place.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era una costruzione molto vecchia, e messa a confronto con la bellezza perfetta del giardino, sembrava piuttosto squallida. Era facile capire perché fosse stato costruito in un punto difficile da notare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Esso era un capanno molto antiquato, e messo a confronto con la perfezione assoluta in cui il roseto era avvolto, sembrava piuttosto squallido, rendendo facilmente comprensibile il motivo per cui fu posto in un luogo in cui non era visibile.
Turkish (TR): Ambar çok eski bir barakaydı ve gül bahçesinin kusursuz güzelliğiyle kıyaslandığında oldukça keyifsiz görünümlüydü. Neden görülmesi zor bir yere inşa edildiğini anlamak kolaydı.

Steam (ST): When Eva looked at where Kanon was pointing, she was at a loss for words. Noticing this, Hideyoshi also followed Kanon's finger and was likewise too shocked to speak.
Umineko Project (UP): When Eva looked at where Kanon was pointing, she was at a loss for words.{n}Noticing this, Hideyoshi also followed Kanon's finger and was likewise too shocked to speak.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Eva looked at where Kanon was pointing, she was at a loss for words. Noticing this, Hideyoshi also followed Kanon's finger and was likewise too shocked to speak.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音が指差す先を見て、絵羽が絶句する。それに気付き、秀吉も嘉音の指の先を見て同様に絶句した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音が指差す先を見て、絵羽が絶句する。{n}それに気付き、秀吉も嘉音の指の先を見て同様に絶句した。
Russian (RU): Когда Ева посмотрела, куда указывал Канон, она лишилась дара речи.{n}Заметив это, Хидэёши взглянул в направлении пальца Канона и тоже оказался настолько шокирован, что не мог вымолвить и слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Eva olhou para onde Kanon estava apontando, ficou sem palavras.{n}Percebendo isso, Hideyoshi também seguiu o dedo de Kanon com os olhos e também ficou sem palavras devido ao choque.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨著嘉音指的方向看去，繪羽不禁瞠目結舌。{n}注意到了異樣的秀吉，也朝著嘉音指的方向看去，同樣被嚇得說不出話來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着嘉音指的方向看去，绘羽不禁瞠目结舌。{n}注意到了异样的秀吉，也朝着嘉音指的方向看去，同样被吓得说不出话来。
Indonesian (IDN): When Eva looked at where Kanon was pointing, she was at a loss for words. Noticing this, Hideyoshi also followed Kanon's finger and was likewise too shocked to speak.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Eva guardò dove Kanon stava indicando, e rimase ammutolita. Notando ciò, anche Hideyoshi guardò il dito di Kanon, ritrovandosi ugualmente sbigottito.
Turkish (TR): Eva, Kanon'un işaret ettiği yere baktığında ne diyeceğini şaşırdı.{n}Bunu fark eden Hideyoshi de Kanon'un parmağını takip etti ve aynı şekilde konuşamayacak kadar şok oldu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): ".........What a vulgar bit of grafitti... ......Could this be...one of those? One of those magic circles used in demonic ceremonies?!"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........What a vulgar bit of graffiti... ......Could this be...one of those? One of those magic circles used in demonic rituals?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........What a vulgar scribble.........Could this be...one of those? One of those magic circles used in demonic ceremonies?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………なんちゅぅ悪趣味な落書きや…。……これ、あれか？　悪魔の儀式とかの、魔法陣ゆうやつとちゃうか？！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………なんちゅぅ悪趣味な落書きや…。……これ、あれか？　悪魔の儀式とかの、魔法陣ゆうやつとちゃうか？！」
Russian (RU): ".........Какая безвкусная и вульгарная мазня... ......Это, часом... не один из тех? Из тех магических кругов, использующихся в демонических ритуалах?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Mas que pichação de mau gosto... ......Será que...é um daqueles? Um daqueles círculos mágicos usados em rituais demoníacos?!"
Vietnamese (VI): ".........What a vulgar bit of graffiti... ......Could this be...one of those? One of those magic circles used in demonic rituals?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………真是低級趣味的亂塗亂畫吶…。……這就是那個嗎？惡魔儀式裡用的那個叫什麼魔法陣的玩意？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………真是低级趣味的乱涂乱画呐…。……这就是那个吗？恶魔仪式里用的那个叫什么魔法阵的玩意？！」
Indonesian (IDN): ".........What a vulgar bit of grafitti... ......Could this be...one of those? One of those magic circles used in demonic ceremonies?!"

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Che graffito volgare... Che sia uno di quei cosi? Uno di quei cerchi di evocazione usati nelle cerimonie sataniche?!"
Turkish (TR): ".........Ne kadar kaba bir grafiti... ......Bu onlardan...biri olabilir mi? Şeytani ritüellerde kullanılan şu büyülü çemberlerden biri mi?!"

Steam (ST): It wasn't surprising that Hideyoshi would say that about such a ghastly shape, drawn with a deep-red, dripping substance.
Umineko Project (UP): With reference to this ghastly shape, drawn with a deep‐red, dripping substance, Hideyoshi's comparison was not unreasonable.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was only natural that Hideyoshi would say that about the ghastly shape, drawn with a deep-red, dripping substance.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真っ赤な何かで滴り落ちるように描かれた不気味な図形を指し、秀吉がそう例えたとしても無理はなかった。
Russian (RU): Было вполне естественно слышать от Хидэёши подобные слова о жутком рисунке, нарисованным тёмно‐красной стекающей субстанцией.

Vietnamese (VI): With reference to this ghastly shape, drawn with a deep‐red, dripping substance, Hideyoshi's comparison was not unreasonable.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對於這用某種血紅色的東西畫成的，濕答答的恐怖圖形，秀吉會這麼比喻也是合情合理。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non ci fu da stupirsi che Hideyoshi usò un simile paragone per quell'immagine angosciante, disegnata con una strana sostanza gocciolante rosso scura.

Steam (ST): It was very rare for Genji, who considered being out of breath a violation of a servant's virtues, to be gasping for air.
Umineko Project (UP): It was very rare for Genji, who considered being out of breath a violation of a servant's virtues, to be gasping for air.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was very rare for Genji, who considered being out of breath a violation of a servant's virtues, to be gasping for air.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 息を切らすことすら使用人の美徳に反すると考える源次が、ぜいぜいと肩で息をしているのはとても珍しいことだった。

Vietnamese (VI): It was very rare for Genji, who considered being out of breath a violation of a servant's virtues, to be gasping for air.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era molto raro vedere Genji, il quale riteneva che ad un domestico non si addicesse il rimanere senza fiato, respirare affannosamente.

Steam (ST): He had probably come dashing back from outside the mansion. His shoulders were soaking wet, and he didn't have his usual trim appearance.
Umineko Project (UP): He had probably come dashing back from outside the mansion.{n}His shoulders were soaking wet, and he didn't have his usual smart appearance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He had probably come dashing back from outside the mansion. His shoulders were soaking wet, and he didn't have his usual smart appearance.
PC Japanese (JP): おそらく、表から駆け戻ってきたのだろう。肩はぐっしょり濡れていて、いつものスマートな源次の雰囲気ではなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): おそらく、表から駆け戻ってきたのだろう。{n}肩はぐっしょり濡れていて、いつものスマートな源次の雰囲気ではなかった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, он прибежал прямо с улицы.{n}Его плечи были насквозь мокрыми, а в облике не было видно обычной для него элегантности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele provavelmente veio correndo de algum lugar fora da mansão.{n}Seus ombros estavam molhados, e ele não tinha o ar sofisticado de sempre.
Vietnamese (VI): He had probably come dashing back from outside the mansion.{n}His shoulders were soaking wet, and he didn't have his usual smart appearance.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 他大概是从外面跑回来的吧。{n}肩膀淋了个透湿，完全没有源次一贯的潇洒气场。
Indonesian (IDN): He had probably come dashing back from outside the mansion. His shoulders were soaking wet, and he didn't have his usual trim appearance.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Probabilmente era venuto dall'esterno della villa correndo. Le sue spalle erano fradicie, e non aveva il suo solito aspetto elegante.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Probabilmente era rientrato di corsa alla villa. Le sue spalle erano bagnate fradicie, e non mostrava il suo tipico portamento composto.
Turkish (TR): Muhtemelen malikanenin dışından koşarak geri dönmüştü.{n}Omuzları sırılsıklamdı ve her zamanki şık görünümüne sahip değildi.

Steam (ST): When Genji noticed Nanjo looking at him, he gave a small, silent bow and quickly approached him.
Umineko Project (UP): When Genji noticed Nanjo looking at him, he gave a small, silent bow and quickly approached him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Genji noticed Nanjo looking at him, he gave a small, silent bow and quickly approached him.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は、南條と目が合ったことに気付くと、軽く黙礼してから早足に近付いてきた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次は、南條と目が合ったことに気付くと、軽く黙礼してから早足に近付いてきた。
Russian (RU): Когда Генджи заметил, что Нанджо смотрит на него, он коротко и беззвучно кивнул и быстро подошёл к нему.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Genji percebeu Nanjo olhando para ele, deu uma pequena e silenciosa reverência e rapidamente se aproximou dele.
Vietnamese (VI): When Genji noticed Nanjo looking at him, he gave a small, silent bow and quickly approached him.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次意識到自己和南條對上了視線，於是默默地簡單行了一禮，快步走了過去。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Accorgendosi di aver incrociato lo sguardo con Nanjo, Genji fece un piccolo inchino silenzioso, e si avvicinò rapidamente verso di lui.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): ".........Doctor Nanjo, my apologies. Please, come with me, quickly."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Doctor Nanjo, my apologies. Please, come with me, quickly."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Doctor Nanjo, my apologies. Please, come with me, quickly."

Steam (ST): As Genji whispered something into Nanjo's ear, Nanjo went pale.
Umineko Project (UP): As Genji whispered something into Nanjo's ear, Nanjo's face changed color.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Genji whispered something into Nanjo's ear, Nanjo's face changed color.

Steam (ST): He rose from the sofa, trying not to be noticed by the children who were still engrossed by the TV, and the two of them rapidly left the parlor, muffling their footsteps.
Umineko Project (UP): He stood from the sofa, trying not to be noticed by the children who were still engrossed by the TV, and the two of them rapidly left the parlor, muffling their footsteps.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He stood from the sofa, trying not to be noticed by the children who were still engrossed by the TV, and the two of them rapidly left the parlor, muffling their footsteps.
PC Japanese (JP): テレビに夢中な子どもたちに気取られないようにソファーを立つと、二人で足音を殺しながら早足に客間を出て行く。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): テレビに夢中な子どもたちに気取られないようにソファーを立つと、二人で足音を殺しながら早足に客間を出て行く。
Russian (RU): Стараясь, чтобы дети, увлечённые передачей по телевизору, не обратили на него внимания, он встал с дивана, и двое, заглушая свои шаги, стремительно покинули гостиную.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Levantou‐se do sofá, tentando não ser percebido pelas crianças, que ainda estavam entretidas com a televisão, e os dois saíram rapidamente da sala de visitas, fazendo o mínimo de barulho possível.
Vietnamese (VI): He stood from the sofa, trying not to be noticed by the children who were still engrossed by the TV, and the two of them rapidly left the parlor, muffling their footsteps.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 孩子們看電視看得正著迷，為了不引起他們的注意，南條小心翼翼地從沙發上站起，兩人盡量壓低著腳步聲，快步走出了客廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 孩子们看电视看得正着迷，为了不引起他们的注意，南条小心翼翼地从沙发上站起，两人尽量压低着脚步声，快步走出了客厅。
Indonesian (IDN): He rose from the sofa, trying not to be noticed by the children who were still engrossed by the TV, and the two of them rapidly left the parlor, muffling their footsteps.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si alzò dal divano, provando a non farsi notare dai ragazzi che erano assorti nel guardare la TV, e i due lasciarono rapidamente il salotto, soffocando i loro passi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Si alzò dal divano, tentando di non farsi notare dai ragazzi assorti dal televisore,{n}e i due lasciarono di corsa il salotto, smorzando i loro passi.
Turkish (TR): Hâlâ televizyona dalmış olan çocuklar tarafından fark edilmemeye çalışarak koltuktan kalktı, ve ikisi birlikte ayak seslerini bastırarak hızla salondan çıktılar.

Umineko Project (UP): Just as they were leaving the parlor, they came across Natsuhi, who was pushing a serving cart loaded with a tea set.

Steam (ST): For some reason, only Natsuhi was outside the storehouse. Without even holding an umbrella, she looked like she was hanging her head, and her back was facing them...

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per qualche ragione, solo Natsuhi, apparentemente col capo chino, si trovava al di fuori del magazzino, ed era voltata di spalle senza neanche avere un ombrello...

Steam (ST): Their faces were smashed, forced into expressions that normal people couldn't make even after death. ...I couldn't tell where the eyes or the noses were, but I could find their mouths...because they were gaping wide, their gums exposed!
Umineko Project (UP): Their faces were smashed, forced into an expression that a normal person couldn't make even after death. ...I couldn't tell where the eyes or the nose were, but I could find the mouth...because it was gaping wide, the ridges of the teeth exposed!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Their faces were smashed, forced into an expression that a normal person couldn't make even after death. ...I couldn't tell where the eyes or the noses were, but I could find their mouths...because they were gaping wide, the ridges of their teeth exposed!
PC Japanese (JP): 顔面は粉砕され、真っ当な人間なら例え死後でも浮かべられないような表情を作らされている。…目の位置も鼻の位置もわからねぇ、口はわかるぜ、歯茎が剥き出しになってて口をぽっかりと開けているから！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 顔面は粉砕され、真っ当な人間ならたとえ死後でも浮かべられないような表情を作らされている。…目の位置も鼻の位置もわからねぇ、口はわかるぜ、歯茎が剥き出しになってて口をぽっかりと開けているから！
Russian (RU): Их лица были размозжены, что придало им облики, которых не бывает у нормального человека даже после смерти. ...Я не смог определить, где были глаза или нос, но я смог разглядеть рты... поскольку они широко зияли выставленными наружу рядами зубов!

Vietnamese (VI): Their faces were smashed, forced into an expression that a normal person couldn't make even after death. ...I couldn't tell where the eyes or the nose were, but I could find the mouth...because it was gaping wide, the ridges of the teeth exposed!

Non riuscivo a definire dove fossero gli occhi, o i nasi, ma riuscivo a vedere le bocche... perché erano spalancate, con i loro denti esposti intrisi di sangue!

Non riuscivo a distinguere dove fossero i loro occhi e il loro naso, ma le loro bocche sì! Perché erano completamente spalancate, e si potevano vedere le gengive!
Turkish (TR): Yüzleri parçalanmış, normal bir insanın öldükten sonra bile yapamayacağı bir ifadeye zorlanmıştı. ...Gözlerin ya da burnun nerede olduğunu anlayamıyordum ama ağzı bulabiliyordum...çünkü genişçe açılmıştı, dişlerin çıkıntıları açıktaydı!

Steam (ST): On an ordinary day, if he had been told to guide the children through the beautiful rose garden, Kanon might have led the way.

Steam (ST): ......But now, there was no distinction between Kanon and the children. ...They were now just kids of about the same age, ...suffering the pain of losing those close to them.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): ".........Genji, ...contact the police immediately. They probably won't be able to come until the typhoon passes, but they should be able to tell us what to do next."

Steam (ST): When she heard that, Natsuhi remembered. That's right, the phones were out today, weren't they...?

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Wait a second! Stop. This is the scene of the crime, isn't it? Then we mustn't disturb it. We all panicked and walked in here with our shoes on, but even that will surely get in the way of the police's investigation, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Wait a second! Stop. This is the scene of the crime, isn't it? Then we can't disturb it. In our confusion, we've tracked muddy footprints all over the scene, and I'm sure that will have caused trouble for the police's investigation!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Wait a second! Stop. This is the scene of the crime, isn't it? Then we can't disturb it. In our confusion, we've tracked muddy footprints all over the scene, but surely that will get in the way of the police's investigation, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ちょっとちょっと！　お待ちなさいよ。ここは犯行現場なんでしょ？　なら変に手を加えちゃ駄目よ。私たちは混乱してて現場に土足で踏み入っちゃったけど、それはきっと警察の捜査の邪魔になったわよぅ？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ちょっとちょっと！　お待ちなさいよ。ここは犯行現場なんでしょ？　なら変に手を加えちゃ駄目よ。私たちは混乱してて現場に土足で踏み入っちゃったけど、それはきっと警察の捜査の邪魔になったわよぅ？」
Russian (RU): "Погодите! Остановитесь. Это место преступления, не так ли? Тогда мы не можем трогать его. В нашем смятении мы оставили грязные следы по всему месту преступления, и это определённо встанет на пути расследования полиции, так ведь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Espera aí! Pare. Esta é a cena de um crime, não é? Então não podemos interferir nela. Nessa confusão toda, nós espalhamos pegadas enlameadas por todo lugar, tenho certeza de que isso vai causar problemas para a investigação da polícia!"
Vietnamese (VI): "Wait a second! Stop. This is the scene of the crime, isn't it? Then we can't disturb it. In our confusion, we've tracked muddy footprints all over the scene, and I'm sure that will have caused trouble for the police's investigation!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「喂喂，等等！給我等一下。這兒是犯罪現場吧？那可不能隨便亂動啊。我們慌了神沒管那麼多就穿著鞋進了現場，這一定已經妨礙到警察取證了！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「喂喂，等等！给我等一下。这儿是犯罪现场吧？那可不能随便乱动啊。我们慌了神没管那么多就穿着鞋进了现场，这一定已经妨碍到警察取证了！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Wait a second! Stop. This is the scene of the crime, isn't it? Then we mustn't disturb it. We all panicked and walked in here with our shoes on, but even that will surely get in the way of the police's investigation, right?"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Aspetta un attimo! Fermo. Questa è la scena del crimine, no? In questo caso non possiamo inquinarla. Nella nostra confusione, abbiamo lasciato tracce di fango su tutta la scena, ma sicuramente ostacolerà l'investigazione della polizia, non pensate?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Aspetta un attimo! Fermati. Questa è la scena di un delitto, vero? Allora non possiamo contaminarla. Eravamo tutti scossi e abbiamo camminato dentro con le nostre scarpe, ma questo di sicuro ostacolerà le indagini della polizia, giusto?"
Turkish (TR): "Bekle bir saniye! Dur. Burası suç mahalli değil mi? Rahatsız edemeyiz. Kargaşamız yüzünden olay yerinin her yerinde çamurlu ayak izleri bıraktık ve eminim bu polisin soruşturması için sorun yaratacaktır!"

Steam (ST): When a criminal hides a body, they're usually trying to delay the point at which it'll be found, so they can use that time to escape.
Umineko Project (UP): Usually, when a criminal hides a body, they are trying to delay the point at which it will be found and use that time to escape.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Usually, when a criminal hides a body, they are trying to delay the point at which it will be found and use that time to escape.
PC Japanese (JP): 犯人が死体を隠すのは、普通、犯行発覚を遅延させその隙に遠方に逃げるための時間稼ぎだ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Normalmente, quando um criminoso esconde um corpo, está tentando atrasar a descoberta do mesmo e usar esse tempo para escapar.
Vietnamese (VI): Usually, when a criminal hides a body, they are trying to delay the point at which it will be found and use that time to escape.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 犯人把尸体藏起来，一般是为了拖延发现犯罪的时间，趁着这个时间逃得远远的。
Indonesian (IDN): When a criminal hides a body, they're usually trying to delay the point at which it'll be found, so they can use that time to escape.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solitamente, quando un criminale nasconde un corpo, cerca di ritardare il lasso di tempo in cui verrà trovato e usarlo per scappare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Normalmente, quando un criminale cela un corpo, guadagna tempo per posticipare la scoperta del reato, e per scappare il più lontano possibile.
Turkish (TR): Genellikle bir suçlu bir cesedi sakladığında, cesedin bulunacağı zamanı geciktirmeye ve bu zamanı kaçmak için kullanmaya çalışır.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): If we want to protect this place from the culprit's hand, I think we should put a new lock on it."
Umineko Project (UP): "......In any case, a lock that the killer has opened once before will not be sufficiently trustworthy on its own. If we want to protect this place from the killer's hand, I think we should put a new lock on."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If we want to protect this place from the culprit's hand, I think we should put a new lock on."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……とにかく、一度は犯人が開け閉めをした施錠だけでは信用できません。犯人の手からもこの場所を保護する意味で、施錠を新たにしたいと言っているのです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……とにかく、一度は犯人が開け閉めをした施錠だけでは信用できません。犯人の手からもこの場所を保護する意味で、施錠を新たにしたいと言っているのです」
Russian (RU): "......В любом случае, мы не можем довериться только замку, который уже открывал преступник. Если мы хотим оградить это место от рук преступника, я думаю, нам следует поставить новый замок."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......De qualquer forma, uma tranca que o assassino já abriu uma vez não vai ser suficientemente confiável por conta própria. Se quisermos proteger este lugar das mãos do assassino, acho que devemos usar uma nova tranca."

Steam (ST): In the midst of the roar of thunder and the pouring rain, the storehouse stood there, ominously... With its closed shutter still covered in a blood-like, creepy substance, it swallowed up the bodies of the six.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the midst of the roar of thunder and the pouring rain, the storehouse stood there, ominously... With its closed shutter still covered in a blood-like, creepy substance, it swallowed up the bodies of the six.
PC Japanese (JP): 雷鳴の混じる大雨の中、不気味にたたずむ倉庫…。閉じられたシャッターには血を思わせる不気味な何かで魔法陣が描かれ、６人もの遺体を飲み込む。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 雷鳴の混じる大雨の中、不気味にたたずむ倉庫…。{n}閉じられたシャッターには血を思わせる不気味な何かで魔法陣が描かれ、６人もの遺体を飲み込む。

Vietnamese (VI): In the midst of the roar of thunder and the pouring rain, the storehouse stood there, ominously...{n}On its closed shutter was the magic circle, drawn in a creepy blood‐like substance, and swallowing up the bodies of six whole people.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 仓库在混杂着雷鸣声的大雨中，阴森森地伫立着…。{n}紧闭的卷闸门上，画着像是用血一般骇人的东西画成的魔法阵。而它，吞噬了六人的遗体。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il magazzino si ergeva minacciosamente, sommerso dalla pioggia battente e dal rombo dei tuoni... I sei cadaveri vennero fagocitati dalla saracinesca serrata, e ricoperta da una sostanza disturbante simile al sangue...

Per Natsuhi, mettere un nuovo lucchetto non era solamente un modo per preservare la scena del crimine per la polizia... si sentiva ancora come se volesse chiudere quella bocca per l'eternità, per evitare che le vittime venissero di nuovo inghiottite da quel demone terrificante...
